loans.name: Chibaty Group

texts.es: Irma tiene 33 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad indígena llamada Donaciano Ojeda, una comunidad donde la principal fuente de empleo es la elaboración de artesanía de ocoshal ya que la materia prima la sacan de los arboles de pino, es por eso que en su comunidad hay brigadas de señores que cuidan sus bosques ya que de ahí se mantiene el pueblo. Dice que los niños en temporada de vacaciones se van a recolectar el ocoshal a los bosques para venderlo a los artesanos de la comunidad y así poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su casa o a veces lo hacen para comprarse dulces y refrescos. Doña Irma tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos estudian la primaria en su comunidad, ella tiene un huerto de aguacates desde hace  2 años, dice que todavía no dan aguacates ya  que están pequeñas las plantas pero que en un año estarán listos, dice que se dedica también a la elaboración de artesanía de ocoshal los cuales vende a compradores que van hasta su comunidad, aunque a ella le gustaría vender sus artesanías en otras ciudades donde le ganara un poco mas y para que se diera a conocer las maravillas que hacen con las palmitas del pino. Ella está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund para la compra de abonos orgánicos “estiércol de borrego”, insecticidas y fertilizantes para mejorar su huerto, también comprara material que ocupa para hacer las artesanías como hilos en diferentes colores, agujas, cloro, jabón y una tina grande para lavar el ocoshal. Ella dice “agradezco a la financiera por confiar en mí y darme créditos para mejorar mis negocios y así poderles dar a mis hijos una mejor vida”. Las demás integrantes del grupo Chibaty se llaman María Leucadia, Amelia y María Crisanta ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para mejorar su huerta de aguacates y en la compra de material para hacer sus artesanías de ocoshal.
texts.en:
Irma, 33, is from the indigenous community of Donaciano Ojea, a community whose main source of employment is the elaboration of handicrafts from "ocoshal" which is the raw material they obtain from pine trees.  In the community there are brigades of men who take care of the forests in order to maintain the village.  During summer vacation the children go off to the forests to collect "ocoshal" to sell to the community artisans.  In this way they help their parents cover household expenses and sometimes buy themselves sweets and refreshments.

Irma has three children who are in elementary school.  She has an avocado field that she has been cultivating for two years.  The field does not produce avocados yet because the plants are small but in a year they should be ready.  She also makes ocoshal crafts that she sells to buyers who visit the community.  She would like to sell them in other cities to earn a little more and to make her beautiful pine palm crafts well known.

She is requesting loan through VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer called "estiércol de borrego"  (sheep manure) and insecticides to improve her cropland.  She will also buy material for her crafts such as thread in different colors, needles, chlorine, soap and a large tub to wash the ocoshal.  She says:  "I am grateful to the lending institution for having confidence in me and for giving me loans to improve my businesses so I can give my children a better life."  

The other members of the Chibaty Group are María Leucadia, Amelia and María Crisanta.  They will use their loans to buy supplies to improve their avocado fields and to buy material to make ocoshal crafts.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer called "lama de borrego", hydrated lime, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 24 years old and single. She works very hard; she runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Jenelyn has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dely

texts.en: Dely is a jolly person. She is 29 years old and married with three kids. She manages a store to have additional income and to save money for the needs of her family; most especially, for the education of her children. Her husband also manages a small farm in their place. They both help each other to sustain the daily needs of their family. Dely wishes to renovate her store someday. She is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy drinks, boxes of candy, spices, and snack foods for her business. She hopes that Kiva lenders will provide her needed loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, boxes of candy, spices, and snack foods for her general store business.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa prepares meals, cold drinks, and some snack foods in her store. Her business site is located close to the government hospital in their municipality, so she is earning good profits. She has been running this business for six years. She has two children attending school. Her husband manages their tricycle and operates it for a transport service.

Her earnings from the business serve their household expenditures. Some of their earned income was invested into other business for additional income like farming. She wants to expand the products that she sells to her costumers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy drinks, meat, and raw ingredients in cooking meals. She hopes to gain a higher income in expanding her stall to accommodate more costumers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, and raw ingredients in cooking food for meals.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en: Lailani is 39 years old with one kid and is married to a simple farmer. She is a diligent person who loves to serve her husband and her kid. She is also known as a very responsible person in their community. In her free time, she helps the community with some of their activities like tree planting. To save money for the future of her child, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy clothes, shampoo, slippers, and accessories to sell around their place. She wishes that next year she will then able to build her own stall in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shampoo, slippers and accessories to sell around their place.

loans.name: Marta Rubiela

texts.es: Marta, a sus 48 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 9 y 12 años. Debido a la necesidad, a la difícil situación económica por la que ha pasado y a la falta de oportunidades de empleo, decidió conseguir los recursos por cuenta propia para el sostenimiento de su familia, montó una venta ambulante en un pequeño carro artesanal de tracción manual donde ofrece mecato, agua en bolsa, limonada, confitería, entre otros; esta actividad la realiza de forma empírica y así ha logrado darle educación a sus pequeños hijos y llevar el alimento a su hogar. Marta es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada, sale a trabajar todas las tardes, luego de dejar todo listo en su casa ya que debe distribuir el tiempo para no descuidar a sus hijos y, lucha constantemente contra los desafíos y obstáculos externos que se le presentan, pues los problemas de orden público y el clima cambiante hacen más difícil su labor. La prestataria solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, galletería, confitería, limonada y agua en bolsa) y cambiará el carrito artesanal  por uno más grande, que le permita tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos. Marta sueña con que la alcaldía le otorgue un kiosco con el que pueda mejorar las condiciones laborales y dar una buena imagen para atraer más clientes, con esto podría mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta, 48, is a single mother of two children, ages 9 and 12.  Out of necessity and due to the difficult economic situation she has been in because of a lack of employment opportunities, she decided to go into business for herself to support her family.  She set up a small street vending business with a small hand-pulled artisan cart she uses to sell cakes, bagged water, lemonade, pastries, etc.   She started working all by herself and has been able to educate her small children and put food on the table.

Marta is a hard-working, dedicated woman who goes out every afternoon after she does the housework.  She must distribute her time in such a way as to be able to attend to her children.  She constantly struggles against challenges and external obstacles that get in her way.  Problems such as civil disorder and climate change make her work more difficult.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy a variety of goods (cakes, cookies, pastries, lemonade and bagged water) and change her artisan cart for a larger one.  This will allow her to have a wider variety of products to offer customers so she can increase her income.  Martha is hoping to get a stall through the city hall so she can improve her work conditions and attract more customers.  This would allow her to improve her family's lifestyle and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy goods (cakes, cookies, pastries, lemonade and bagged water) and to acquire a larger cart.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 54 years old, married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Felisa has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a happy woman. She is engaged in a retailing store. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a government employee. Her two children are attending school. To make living, Jennifer engages in selling electrical supplies and sewing machines. Her stall is located in the public market. She wants to offer more products to her customers at her site; that is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy electrical supplies such as circuit breakers, electrical lamps, and stoves to sell. She hopes to further expand her stall through the profits gained from her business.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies such as circuit breakers, electrical lamps, and stoves to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Nenita successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in order to build her business. NWTF is re-listing Nenita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 65 years old and lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is widowed with three children.

She has a shop that sells different kinds of home products and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Josefa hopes to make her little store into a bigger one or maybe a grocery store.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for her store business.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married with 1 child. Melanie is 50 years old and lives in Nabuna, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
Melanie sells different varieties of fish to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a Php 20,000 loan to pay for a variety of fish to sell.

Melanie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Melanie hopes to expand her business and have plenty of savings deposited for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with 2 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She requested a loan to buy more pigs to raise.

Marites has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to build a piggery to grow more pigs and hopes to open her own meat shop.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is married with 5 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Isabelita buys and sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 for additional capital. In the future, Isabelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is a widow with two children who are of infant-age. Antonette is 30 years old and lives in Balolong, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She operates her poultry business to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns about PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy more chickens and sacks of feeds.  In the future, Antonette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en:
Andrew, who is in his late 30s, is married. For two years now, he has been managing two enterprises. He is a photographer and he also has a motorbike service (bodaboda). He is doing well with his businesses. He works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good return each month. This is Andrew's 7th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy a big camera for his business. 

With the previous loans, all of which repaid back successfully, he managed to built a business premises (Photo studio) where he is now able to receive more orders. With the business profit received, he bought a plot of land in another region, built a house in an area where he stays and covered his home expenses. 

Andrew dreams that one day he will be able to own a big photo studio and expand his motorbike service. He will share this loan with his loan group "MAKOKA" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a big camera for his business.

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en: Renerio is 64 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 6 children. Renerio has a sewing business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for additional capital. Renerio has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: for additional capital for his sewing business and for machine maintenance

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a 41-year-old single mother of two in Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a boutique. Due to limited income to fund her business, she has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request a loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to purchase more bales of women's clothing, men's clothing and children's clothing. She will expand her customer base which, in return, will increase her sales and increase her profits too.

Currently, her business gives her a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will save for her children’s education and repay her loan. In the future, Caroline would like to continue to invest in her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of women's clothing, men's clothing and children's clothing

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi appreciates the loan he was given last time that enabled him to get profits that he used to pay school fees for his children.

He is now requesting a loan of Ksh10,000 to purchase fruits, tomatoes and vegetables for his business. This will enable him to improve his living standards and take care of his family members. He joined Yehu to get access to the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, tomatoes and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 40 years old, married to Phillip, and she supports a family of four. She is blessed with children between the ages of 12 and 18 years. She is a small scale horticulture farmer in Ainamoi location in Kericho county. She has been in this business for the last four years, and from this business she gets an average monthly income of KES 23,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 120,000, which is her third loan with KADET Ltd. With this loan she plans to use KES 50,000 to purchase maize seeds, fertilizers, and pay for labor, and the rest of the money will be used to buy young chicks for breeding.

With the anticipated profits Hellen intends to pay back the loan as well as pay school fees for her children.  Her dream is to have her business grow and start a dairy farming business under a zero grazing unit.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста трудолюбивая и энергичная девушка. Ей 23 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Гулдаста имеет умелые руки. Она шьёт красивые платья. Гулдаста имеет достаточно опыта и поэтому она решила организовать свой бизнес шитьём женской одежды. Она будет справляться с бизнесом сама. Гулдаста обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gludasta is a hardworking and energetic young woman. She is 23, single, and lives with her parents. Gludasta is very skilled with her hands, and makes beautiful dresses. She is quite experienced at this, and has decided to organize her own business making women's dresses. She is going to run the business herself; she took the course "Getting Ahead", which was given by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate of completion. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to purchase a sewing machine, and awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mehrona

texts.ru: Мехроне 20 лет. Она не замужем. Мехрона планирует организовать свой бизнес и найти источника дохода. Она умеет шить женские платья. Мехрона давно мечтала начать свое дело, но у нее не было, ни поддержки, ни средств. После того, как она обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, она научилась создать бизнес – план и вести свое дело. Она обратилась за займом с целью того, чтобы найти средства для организации бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mekhrone is 20 years old, and single. She is planning to organize her own business so she can earn some income. She knows how to make women's dresses. She has long dreamed of starting her own business, but had neither the help nor the money. She took the course "Getting Ahead", which was given by the Association of Businesswomen, and learned how to start a business, how to create a business plan and operate the business. She applied for a loan to obtain the funds she needs to organize her business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to buy a sewing machines. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод житель города Душанбе, столицы Таджикистана. Ему 39 лет. Он имеет жену и двух дочерей. Дилшод любит свою семью и старается хорошо обеспечивать семью. Он трудолюбивый и усердно работающий человек. Дилшод в течение года находился на заработках в загранице. Он вернулся на родину недавно и хочет работать здесь. Дилшод собирается заниматься предоставлением услуги такси. Он накопил сбережение в размере 1250 долларов США и еще просит в кредит 3000 долларов США для покупки надежного и экономичного микроавтобуса марки Hyundai Starex для перевозки пассажиров. Дилшод уже выбрал маршрутный путь, по которому будет работать и совершать 8 рейсов в день. Он имеет двухлетний опыт работы водителем. 
Кредит поможет Дилшоду иметь собственный бизнес в своем городе и получать хороший доход. Он ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in Duushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. He is 39, married, and has two daughters. Dilshod loves his family and tried hard to provide for them. He is an industrious and hardworking person. Dilshod spent a year working abroad; he returned home recently and wants to work here. He is planning on working as a private taxi driver. He has 1250 dollars in savings and is asking for 3000 US dollars more to purchase a reliable and economical Hyundai Starex minivan for transporting his passengers. He has already selected the route on which he will make 8 runs per day. He has two years of driving experience. The loan will help Dilshod to start his own business in his home town, and will provide him with a god income. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: to purchase an Hyundai Starex minivan for transporting passengers

loans.name: Ruthuer

texts.es: Ruthuer, de 39 años de edad, está casada con Bamner quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 13 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Ruthuer se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de escobas para eso cuenta con pequeño taller instalado en su casa, donde tiene 2 maquinas para realizar los corte de la madera y las cerdas, luego los ensambla logrando sacar un buen producto. Todos sus productos son vendidos al por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados cercanos, donde tiene pedidos por entregar. Se inició hace más de 15 años con un capital propio y en sociedad con su esposo, quien la ayuda en la elaboración y venta de sus productos, y en ocasiones también cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenia problemas económicos ya que no contaba con un oficio ni ingresos constantes haciendo que la economía en su casa sea difícil.  Ahora viendo los buenos resultados que sigue teniendo desea continuar pues es su única fuente de ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 700 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus escobas como madera y cerdas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruthuer, 39, is married to Bamner who is a shopkeeper and the father of her 3 children ages 21, 18 and 13 whom all live with them in their own house. 

Ruthuer makes and sells brooms. She has a small workshop in her house where she has 2 machines for cutting wood and cutting bristles. She then assembles them making a good product. All her products are sold in bulk to retailers at nearby markets where she fulfills her orders. She began more than 15 years ago with her own funds, together with her husband, who helps her to make and sell the products and sometimes helps her take care of her youngest child. 

Before starting her business, she had economic problems since she didn't have a trade or constant income causing the finance in her house difficult. Now seeing the good results that she continues to have, she wants to continue because it's her only source of income. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support she is receiving to continue ahead. In addition, she promises to pay her monthly payments on time. With the amount asked, 700 Peruvian Soles, she will buy materials such as wood and bristles at wholesale to make brooms.

loans.use: to buy wood and bristles to make brooms.

loans.name: Fanny Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Fanny tiene 22 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en su mismo domicilio que es por la zona de Santa Martha,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Fanny utilizara este préstamo para la compra  de un Frizer para mantener sus vegetales y carne conservados para así elaborar sus platillos, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y ofrecer variedad de sus platillos a sus clientes y brindarles la comodidad así incrementar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ms. Fanny is 22 years old. She sells food out of the food stall in her home, which is in the Santa Martha area. This loan is her first with the institution. Ms. Fanny will use this loan to buy a freezer to preserve her vegetables and meat to be able to make her dishes. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that she has been given to grow her business. Her dream is to be able to have a restaurant and offer a variety of dishes to her clients. She hopes to make them comfortable and to increase her customers, as well as her economic income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Esteria Mururi is 44 years old, married and a mother of four children.  

She makes and sells beaded sandals in Malindi. She has been in this business for the last five years, with a monthly income of KES 5,420. 

Esteria was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000.  She intends to buy additional stock of beads and leather for her business. Esteria will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children as well as grow her business. 

In future, she hopes to continue growing the business and also to venture into other investments.

loans.use: To purchase additional material needed for her business.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Doña Florinda de 29 años casada y tiene dos hijos uno ya estudia, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años pero también con el apoyo de su esposa pudo comprar un microbús que ahora utiliza para trabajar ya que es bus escolar, doña Florinda vende frijol en grano en el mercado municipal de Santiago sac, desde hace 8 años las personas la buscan ya que ella compra por mayor y eso hace que pueda dar un buen precio de venta, también dependiendo de la temporada vende maíz para pollitos,  naranjas peladas, concentrado, esta agradecida por que también tienen una sastrería donde dos veces a la semana atienden, ahora desea comprar por mayor y asi obtener mas ganancias ya que este producto es de venta diaria, y seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante, les agradese por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que por medio de ustedes ella a podido hacer parte de su sueño realidad, espera que le puedan seguir ayudando con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Florinda is 29 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.  Florinda´s husband has been working in construction for ten years but, along with support from his wife, he was able to buy a minibus that serves as a school bus and that he uses for work.  Florinda sells bean seeds in Santiago's town market.  She has been doing this work for eight years, with people coming to look for Florinda as she sells in bulk and offers good prices.  Depending on the season, she also sells corn for chickens, oranges, and animal feed.  Florinda is grateful because she also has a tailoring workshop where, twice a week, she tends to her customers.  Florinda now wants to buy her products in bulk and so earn higher profits - she sells the beans every day - and continues helping her family to get ahead in life.  Florinda is grateful for the help being provided and, thanks to you, she has been able to make part of her dream a reality.  She hopes that you can continue to help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén tiene 24 años, el tiene la actividad de transporte de pasajeros en la localidad de el Torno él es moto taxista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Rubén va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una  motocicleta  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Rubén va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos y si se puede otra motocicleta, El Sr. Rubén es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse, el deseo del El Sr. Rubén es tener una tienda donde pueda vender motocicletas.
texts.en: Mr. Rubén is 24 years old. He is a motorcycle taxi driver who transports passengers in the locality of Torno. This loan is his first with the institution. Mr. Rubén is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle. This will allow him to offer better service to his clients and increase his earnings. His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his business. Mr. Rubén is going to use the proceeds to keep buying spare parts and another motorcycle if he can. Mr. Rubén is a very hardworking person. He is happy for the opportunity he has been offered, since it is the only job he has. Mr. Rubén’s dream is to have a shop where he can sell motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a very hardworking man. He lives in Kenya and owes his own vegetable stall. His vision is to expand his vegetable stall and increase his profit margin.

He is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, potatoes and onions for his business. He joined Yehu microfinance in order to access the loan funds with low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, potatoes and onions for his business.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is 51 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last ten years. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to buy some clothing material for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees of her children. 

In future, Binti hopes to grow her tailoring shop with a view of opening up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing material for her tailoring business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 47 years old, married to Charles and blessed with five children. 

She sells bricks, a business she has been doing for the past three years, and earns a monthly income of  KES 10,000. 

She has requested a fourth loan of KES 90,000 to purchase materials for making bricks. The profit she earns will help her start a new line of business by purchasing a motorbike for transportation. 

Her dream is to give her children the best education and to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Magereza Group

texts.en: Amina, who is in her late 20s, is married with a son who is in school. For five years now, Amina has been managing her family expenses by having a water distribution service. She owns water wells where she uses pumping machines to get water. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good return every month. This is Amina's second loan request form Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy new pipes and clean her wells. With the previous loan, all of which was repaid successfully, she bought another pump to improve her water distribution services. She used her business profit to cover home expenses and school fees. Amina dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business. She will share this loan with her loan group "Magereza," which consists of 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new pipes and clean her wells.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: La Sra. Aurora tiene 25 años, casada con dos hijos  pequeños, la Sra. Aurora se dedica a la  venta de comida, ella vende pollo broaster,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Aurora utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de asador para pollo a la broaster por su negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero, para la compra de una brostera que mucha falta le hace en su negocio, la Sra. Aurora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela para así generar mayores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su hogar y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Aurora is 25 years old. She is married and has two small children. Mrs. Aurora sells food, specifically broasted chicken. This loan is her first with the institution. Mrs. Aurora will use the loan to buy a rotisserie for broasted chicken for her business. She is requesting the loan because she does not have the money to buy a broaster, which her business really needs. Mrs. Aurora faces challenges in her business. She hopes to increase her customer base to generate more income. Mrs. Aurora is going to use the proceeds to buy household items and, in this way, to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie for broasted chicken.

loans.name: Rodolfina

texts.es: La Sra. Rodolfina sigue con la misma actividad de la crianza y venta de cerdos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en el mantenimiento de su vehículo,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus cerdos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Rodolfina continues to raise and sell pigs, commenting that her previous loan went well for her because she used it for the maintenance of her vehicle. This time she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed for her pigs. She feels happy and thankful for the opportunity that is being given to her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children. 

Leonila has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She is also engaged in selling kakanin (sweet rice cakes) and fruit vending and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional goods and consumable products for retail.
 
Leonila has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods and consumable products.

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne appreciates the Kiva loan he was given that enabled him to get profits that he used to pay school fees for his children.

He is requesting a new loan of KES 10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, onions and potatoes for his grocery store. He joined Yehu to get access to the loan funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, onions and potatoes for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with five kids. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

Over the past years, she has operated a food selling business, selling dumpling and coconuts from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a shop in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of coconuts and wheat flour for use in cooking dumplings. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of coconuts and wheat flour for use in cooking dumplings.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who was born in the early 1970s, is married with two sons who are in school. Since 2000, Tatu has been running a shop selling fabrics, sarongs and bedsheets. She is also a tailor in the same shop. She is doing fine in her business and her family also. 

Tatu works from 08 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth loan request. She will use the loan to buy more cloth and tailoring materials. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she managed to buy an overlock tailoring machine, more bedsheets, fabrics and sarongs which were sold. With the business profit, she paid school fees and started building her house. She dreams that one day she will able to finish building her family house and improving her business. 

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Tanzania" which consist of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, a widowed mother of seven from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan term with KADET Ltd. after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

With the loan from KADET, she will be able to purchase poultry feed, animal feed and a dairy cow. Additional income created will allow her improve the standard of living for her family and reinvest the remaining amount in her business. 

In the future, Charity would like to buy more dairy cows. She hopes to save money to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed, animal feed and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 57 year sold and a single mother of three children. 

She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the past 13 years to support her children. 

The business has grown since she took the first loan to boost her stock, with an increase in her monthly income, which she says is now KES 40,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 100,000 to purchase more bags of maize and wheat. The profit she earns will help her start a new line of business. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize and wheat for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema greatly appreciated her previous Kiva loan, which enabled her to continue running her business and increase her profits because she was able to buy a new sewing machine. She is a very hardworking woman and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase material, buttons, thread and needles for her business.

Rehema joined Yehu to access loan funds and boost her business.

loans.use: to buy material, buttons, thread and needles for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 36 años de edad es una persona humilde pero trabajadora, curso tan solo hasta la primaria ya que por cuestiones económicas no pudo continuar con sus estudios, por lo que desde muy joven ayuda en las labores de la agricultura, es así que ella tiene gran experiencia, lleva más de 20 años en la siembra de papa, maíz, zapallo entre otros; hoy desea el presente crédito para poder refaccionar la vivienda que habita ya que se encuentra deteriorada, es necesario que Rosa realice estas refacciones para poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida, y sobre todo para esta época de invierno. Rosa es de estado civil soltera pero lleva conviviendo más de 8 años con el Sr. José que por cuestiones de trabajo no participa del presente crédito ya que el mismo se encuentra trabajando en el vecino país Argentina, quien con mucho sacrificio trabaja para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Thirty-six year old Rose is a humble but hard-working person. She only has primary level education because, due to economic issues, she was unable to stay in school. From a very young age she helped out, doing agricultural work. This is why she has a lot of experience. For more than 20 years she has been planting potato, corn, squash and other crops. 

Today, she is requesting a loan to renovate her house because it is in disrepair. Rosa must make these repairs to be able to offer her children better living conditions, especially for the winter. 

Rosa is unmarried but has cohabited with Jose for more than 8 years. Due to his work situation, he is not participating in the present loan. He is currently working in neighboring Argentina with great sacrifice in order to sustain his family.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman and she has three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a cashew nut selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts  for resale. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts  for resale.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children and equally responsible for all of them. She belongs to an ultra poor family that is why she cannot afford educational expenses, so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers on daily wages. 

One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding materials.  Sughran requested a loan of Rs.30,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy materials to carry on his business. 

Sughran is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy materials such as iron rods, welding rods, and soldering rods for welding work.

loans.name: Ovidio De Jesús

texts.es: Ovidio a sus 50 años de edad es un hombre separado y padre de 1 hijo. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y debido a la difícil situación económica por la que ha pasado, decide aprender la actividad de la jardinería y desde hace 2 años trabaja como jardinero independiente, podando y arreglando los jardines en casas y fincas cercanas al lugar donde reside. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm y actualmente labora sólo. Con esta actividad ha logrado conseguir ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Ovidio es un señor pujante, trabajador, se esfuerza día a día para sacar adelante su hijo, es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (2 guadañas) para darle continuidad a su labor y prestar un servicio más ágil y oportuno, ya que podrá generar un empleo que le permita conseguir más contratos y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos para disfrutar con su hijo.  Ovidio sueña con seguir realizando su trabajo y que éste le permita lograr una estabilidad económica para mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ovidio, 50, is separated with one child. Due to a lack of opportunities for work and the difficult economic situation he found himself in, Ovidio decided to learn gardening and has been working independently as a gardener, pruning and tidying up the gardens of houses and farms around where he lives. His working day is 6am to 4pm and he works alone. Through this activity he has been able to earn enough money to support his household. Ovidio is a hardworking man who strives every day to help his son get ahead in life. He is asking for a loan with the aim of investing it in buying tools for his job (two scythes), to allow him to work more effectively and offer a better service, which will in turn enable him to generate more business and increase the money he can spend on his son. Ovidio's dream is that by continuing to work he will be able to achieve economic stability to improve his family's wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his job (two scythes).

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita has a sari-sari store business in her village in the Philippines. She has run the business for over 14 years now, while her husband is a farmer. Their income sustains their children's school expenses and the couple are striving to support their children's needs until they finish college. 

Nowadays, vendors and business owners in the market where Estrelita buys her goods are increasing their product prices due to the expense of transportation. Estrelita also pays high transport fees and therefore is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy large volumes of various grocery items. This will enable her to minimize her transport expenses and she hopes this will help her increase her income. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will approve her loan request.

loans.use: to buy large volumes of grocery items for her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 30 years old. He is married to Gladys and blessed with a 4-year-old child. He is in the transport business, offering such services with his motorbike. He has been in this business for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Sammy has seen his business grow and now has requested a fifth loan of 100,000 KES to purchase another motorbike. The profit he earns will help him purchase bags of maize and cows. He dreams of seeing his business expand and purchasing a piece of land to start serious farming.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four kids. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour and cooking oil to use in preparing dumplings. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour and cooking oil to use in preparing dumplings.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 34 years old and the father of two children, both of whom are currently studying. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Malindi, where he earns a monthly profit of 14,500 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Harrison was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of 40,000 KES to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Harrison hopes to own his own supermarket in the future so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase stock needed for his business.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en: Josiah is a 35 year old from Nyahururu, Kenya. His wife, Philys, is a housewife, and they have 3 children, aged 13, 11 and 9. Josiah is a carpenter. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. He has applied for a second loan from KADET Ltd. after his previous one was repaid successfully, and he intends to use this loan to buy more materials, such as timber, for his business. In the future, Josiah hopes to be a successful businessman in his village.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as timber, for his business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Mary Jane would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 15,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates the Kiva loan that enabled her to run her vegetable stall and to get profits that she used to open a tailoring business. 

She is requesting a loan of Ksh.10,000 to purchase fabrics, dress materials, thread and needles for her business.She joined Yehu Microfinance to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, dress materials, thread and needles for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 53 years old and married, with three children.

Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leah has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Leah aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jemhoi Group

texts.en:
“I strongly believe that to live without hope is to cease to live,” shares Tingkhohoi. She is pictured with her hand raised and is the featured borrower member for “Jemhoi-Group”. She has one son only and lives with her husband in a village which is about 45 kms away from the city capital of Imphal. Imphal is one of the capital states of the North-Eastern states of India. She has switched her business from growing and selling vegetables to running a variety shop in the village. Her husband also earns his living as a farmer. He ploughs others' fields and earns his daily wages. The family financial resources are entirely borne by Tingkhohoi and her husband. 

Tingkhohoi runs a general store in the village. She sells only essential goods for the villagers which include detergent soaps, detergent powder, sachets of shampoo, different cereals, edible oils, loose as well as in pouches, candies, sweets, tea-leaves, sugar, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, etc. She usually gets her stocks from the city market and also from army canteen suppliers. She usually gets cosmetic items like hair-oil, face-cream, soap/powdered soap from army canteen suppliers. The rates are subsidized as the supply is purchased from the army canteen at a cheaper rate as compared to the market rate. She sells only the basic needs or required items for the villagers as villagers are her sole customers.  

Tingkhohoi wants a loan to refill her general store with more cereals, imported rice, edible oils, etc. She aspires to supply the villagers on a credit basis in the future. She shared that, instant cash payment for goods by the buyers in the village is not easy. The villagers are managing their expenses with the meager income that they generate. If she can abundantly stock her store and be a supplier for the villagers, then the unnecessary spending on fares for transportation to purchase small items like soap or edible oil could be prevented and she will be able to make good sales, which will literally generate good income and will facilitate the villagers, too. 

She thanked KIva and WSDS for the joint movement to facilitate women entrepreneurs. She and the other member wish them good-will and progress in their future works. She says, “Thank you, Kiva!” 

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving, poultry, and piggery.

loans.use: To purchase goods to refill the general store with cereals, imported rice, edible oils and kids'  delicacies to earn more profits.

loans.name: Lesly Xiomara

texts.es:
Lesly es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida se crio solo con su madre ya que su papa murió cuando ella era una niña y su madre con todo el sacrificio la saco adelante y logro que cursara la secundaria completa. En su juventud le enseño a trabajar en el negocio que en la actualidad trabaja como ser el comercio con la venta de verduras. Ella es madre de 25 años de edad, soltera y con 2 hijos el primero tiene 6 años es varón está cursando primer grado de primaria, el segundo 3 años es hembra no estudia. La propiedad donde ella habita es adquirida por herencia por parte del padre de sus hijos. Ella cuenta con el apoyo y experiencia de su madre la cual se ha dedicado al comercio desde toda una vida ya que es la fuente de ingresos de la familia para adquirir lo básico y poder salir adelante.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder abrir un negocio de venta de verduras en su casa de habitación ya que es punto estratégico en la zona donde ella habita y la clientela es mucha.

Lesly sueña con iniciar con su negocio de venta de verduras de manera propia generar ganancias para ella y su familia ya que de esa manera ella podrá ver a sus hijos crecer verlos convertidos en profesionales mediante el estudio.
texts.en:
Lesly was raised alone by her mother for the majority of her life because her father died when she was a young girl. Her mother helped to get her ahead and was able to send her to secondary school with all the sacrifices that she made. During her youth, her mother taught her to work with the business that she now has selling vegetables. She is a 25 year old single mother with two children. The oldest is a six year old boy in first grade and her youngest is a three year old girl who is not yet in school. The land where she lives was acquired by the father of her children. She relies on her mother's support and experience from having sold goods all of her life, from which she has received income to take care of her family's basic needs and be able to get ahead. 

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to open a business selling vegetables from her home. This is a strategic location in the area where she lives and the clientele is large. Lesly dreams of starting up her own business selling vegetables on her own to generate earnings for herself and her family. In this way she will be able to see her children grow to become career professionals through their studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to be resold.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Este el nuevo grupo “Sol Naciente” conformado por 06 socios dedicados a distintas actividades de comercio, siendo la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona.  Alicia de 29 años es  casada con 02 hijos aún dependientes. Con los deseos de aportar con los gastos del hogar Alicia toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio, pues hace más de 02 años cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda. Gracias a su trabajo puede cubrir con los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo desinará para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. El nuevo grupo “Sol Naciente” agradecen el crédito brindado. Alicia se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo rosado y casaca negra.
texts.en: This new group, called 'Sol Naciente' (meaning 'rising sun'), is comprised of six members engaged in various retail activities. Most of them live in the same neighbourhood as one another. Alicia, 29 years old, is married and has two children, who are still in her care. She has a shop in her house, which she started two years ago. A desire to contribute to household expenses is what motivated her decision to start her own business. Thanks to the shop, Alicia can pay for her children's education. Her biggest dream is to finish building her house. The loan will go towards buying groceries, drinks, and sweets to sell. The whole group is thankful for the help extended by lenders. In the picture, Alicia is sitting down, the first woman from the right, and wearing a black cardigan over a pink T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Editha has a food vending business in the Philippines. To sustain and develop the business, Editha is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 which she will utilize to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and bananas for her food business. Editha has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and bananas for her food business.

loans.name: Carlota Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora. Carlota está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de la compañía de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Yanaturo Alto, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de la naturaleza, es cuna de grandes artistas y artesanos, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Del grupo de crédito le gusta el compañerismo y la solidaridad de todas sus vecinas.

Doña Carlota tiene 52 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, su último hijo tiene 13 años y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en que vive es propia.

La Señora Carlota para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar trabaja como empleada en un restaurante de lunes a sábados, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos a los que los vende pelados o en pie. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a ser invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para pollos.

Su sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Carlota is seeking her second loan in the company of her friends and colleagues of the Yanaturo Alto communal bank. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, a city known for the beauty of its nature, which is the birthplace of great artists and craftsmen. Its people still maintain the city's culture and traditions. What Carlota likes about the communal bank is the feeling of companionship and solidarity of all her neighbors.

Carlota is 52, she is married and the fruit of her marriage is 4 children, three of whom are adults, they are married and live alone. Her youngest is 13 years old and is studying in a high school in the city. Her husband works as a builder, and the home in which she lives is her own.

To help her husband cover the household costs, Carlota works as a restaurant employee from Monday to Saturday. At home, she rears poultry which she sells plucked or as is.

She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chicken and chicken feed. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe appreciates Kiva for the loan she was given that enabled her to pay school fees for her children. She operates a kiosk business that she wants to expand.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 10,000 to purchase sacks of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. She joined Yehu microfinance to access these funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and married with four children who are all in school. Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sardines, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Ybycui, viene de una familia muy trabajadora y tiene 4 hermanos. Es estudiante, está siguiendo la carrera de Administración de Empresas, con lo que el día de mañana quiere ser un gran profesional.
Su meta es ser un gran profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo, y por sobre todo gracias a su conocimiento.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Diego is from the city of Ybycui. He comes from a very hardworking family and has four siblings. Diego is a student who is studying for a degree in Business Administration. He hopes that one day he will become a successful professional.

His goal is to become a successful professional so that he can help other people through his work, his efforts, but most of all, with his knowledge. Diego is requesting this loan so that he can pay his university fees. This will enable him to continue his studies as usual. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received so that he can make progress.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: Narcisa tiene 53 años viuda inicio su de negocio de venta de tamales y humitas en forma ambulatoria a la vez cría aves de corral como gallinas y patos. De esta manera a podido  educar a sus hijos cuando estos aún era dependiente. Años atrás se dedicaba a ser ama de casa. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz aceite y azúcar. Su mayor deseo es mejorar su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Narcisa es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo azulino. Y de la misma manera esta incluida la foto de Andres en la parte suprior derecha  que llego tarde a la reunión por haber estado laborando.
texts.en: Narcisa is fifty-three and is a widow.  She has a business selling tamales and ground corn as a street vendor.  She also raises poultry like chickens and ducks.  In this way, she has been able to educate her children when they were still dependent on her.  Years ago, she was a housewife.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of corn, oil, and sugar.  Her biggest wish is to improve her home.  Her group is thankful to the Kiva investors for this loan.  Narcisa is the third person from the right in the photo, dressed in the blue shirt.  The photo at the top right is of Andrés, who arrived late to the meeting because he was working.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel, de 21 años, es soltero y cuida de sus padres y sus 3 hermanos menores en una casa alquilada. Samuel se dedica a dar el servicio de taxi por su ciudad. Le gusta mucho de su trabajo pues le brinda el sustento para su hogar. Comenta que el secreto para tener buenos ingresos es mantener en buen estado el auto, por lo que el mantenimiento permanente es importante, es así que cada 4 meses realiza un inspección exhaustiva a su vehículo y de esa manera no tiene daños fuertes que le puedan costar el doble de la inversión y no pueda trabajar con normalidad. Este es su primer préstamo con kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual
Samuel, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en  el mantenimiento mecánico de su automóvil.
texts.en:
Samuel, 21, is single and cares for his parents and three younger siblings in a rented house.  Samuel works providing taxi services throughout his city.  

He likes his work very much because it provides sustenance for his home.  He comments that the secret of earning good income is to keep his car in good condition which is why regular maintenance is so important.  Therefore, every four months he carries out a detailed inspection of his vehicle to avoid major problems that can cost double and keep him from working normally.

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he’s getting to continue forward; he commits to make his payments punctually.  Samuel will use the 1,000 soles to provide mechanical maintenance for his auto.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
This is Cleofe. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. The income generated helped to pay for her family's daily expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. Aside from her variety store, she also has a piggery and sells vegetables. 

Cleofe would like to apply for another 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan to add groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to her current inventory. The more items displayed in her store, the better her profits will be. And her increased income will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cleofe hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her whole family, including her grandchildren, will always be in good health. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Bellavista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Bellavista está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes se dedican en su mayoría a la ganadería, a la venta de leche y a la agricultura, estas actividades las han aprendido de sus padres, son personas que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió que cuenta con grandes llanuras y verdes campos, su geografía es accidentada con hermosos paisajes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Hilda, este es su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras, los créditos le gustan porque así puede aportar económicamente a su hogar.

La Señora Hilda tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 6 años, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo es soltero y trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión latonero y labora en un taller de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

Doña Hilda se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene ganado del cual vende la leche, gallinas y cuyes, también cultiva su tierra y lo que  cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar pero si existe algún sobrante lo vende. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va ser invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros y en alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su meta es estudiar belleza.
texts.en:
The "Bellavista" loan group is made up of seven women and one man who make a living primarily in livestock, the sale of milk and other agricultural products. These activities have been taught to them by their parents. They continue to maintain their culture and local traditions. They live in the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca, which has a cold climate with great plains, green fields and beautiful landscapes. One of the members of the group is Hilda. This is her second loan that she is taking out with her friends and partners. She likes the loans because they allow her to economically support her household. 

Hilda is 43 years old, married and has four children with her husband who are 23, 21, 19, and 6 years old. Her two oldest children are married and live on their own. The third child is single and works to cover his personal expenses and the youngest is studying in a small neighborhood school. Her husband is an auto body worker and works from a workshop on their property. The house in which they live is the fruit of both of their hard work. Hilda makes a living raising animals. She has milk producing cows, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also grows crops on her land to harvest for their household consumption, with any surplus being sold. The money from this loan will be invested to purchase manure to improve her pastures, and feed for her animals. Her goal is to study cosmetology.

loans.use: To buy manure and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy string, reeds, gunpowder, and cellophane

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado Nueva Estrella está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas integran el programa de eliminación de pobreza y están luchando por mejorar su pobreza. Una de la integrantes, La Sra. Cristina, ella es  presidenta  del grupo, quien en su última encuesta  demostró un nivel de ingresos medios, y esto la inspira más a seguir luchando y esforzándose. Ella alienta  a sus compañeras del grupo a seguir trabajando en equipo y por medio  del esfuerzo de cada una y, el trabajo constante y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa el grupo se  encuentra  aumentando sus ingresos. Ella tiene como actividad las ventas ya que tiene una “Mercería”. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de ropa, lo que le permitirá  a concretar su plan de negocio, lo cual le ayudara a conseguir más ingreso y más clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Nueva Estrella” (New Star) is in cycle #6 in the women’s committee program.  They are part of a poverty elimination program and are striving to improve.  

One of the members is Cristina.  She’s the group president.  In the previous survey she was middle-income and this inspires her to continue striving and making even more effort.  She encourages her fellow group members to continue working as a team and by means of each of their work, by constant work, and by applying vital behaviors of successful women, the group is increasing their income.

Her activity is sales; she has a variety store and is asking for this loan to buy clothes to fulfill her business plan which will help her earn higher income and acquire more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Esperanza está haciendo su ciclo numero 5, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias, están también haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer en qué situación esta cada una.
Una persona digna de mencionar es Epifania, quien trabaja en la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, comenta que los fines de semana es cuando más venta tiene, y que le está yendo muy bien en su emprendimiento. Ella está superando su pobreza por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo duro.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, energizantes y demás insumos ya que quiere surtir su negocio y de esa forma surtir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named "la Esperanza" is in its fifth phase of the Poverty Stoplight Program. They are hard working women who got together with the hope of being able to help their families. They are also using the poverty measurement tool to understand everyone's situation. 

One dignified person to mention is Epifania. She sells all types of beverages. She says her sales are the highest during the weekends and that things are going very well for her. 

She is overcoming her poverty through effort and hard work. 

She is requesting a loan to buy soda, wine, beer, energy drinks and other supplies so that she can expand her business and increase customers.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, energy drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Organizadas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Herminia  es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad HORQUETA donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura mercería, y producto de limpieza en general donde tiene su local. Ella desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras de toda clase, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The community bank 'Mujeres Organizadas' is in its first loan cycle.  The group is located in an area of the city of Concepción that is a little far from the city center.  Nevertheless, the area is still growing.  The area is difficult to access, so the group members want to fight to continue to grow and to create a better environment where they live, and for their area to continue slowly growing.

Herminia is one of the group members.  She is from a small colony in the Horqueta district, where she has her small business selling fruits and vegetables, as well as cleaning products.  As time goes by, she hopes that, with the help of all the residents in her area, there will be improvements in her community, thus providing better security to their families and leading to a better future for all of them.

She is seeking this loan so that she can purchase fruits and vegetables of all types.  This will enable her to continue to grow her business and thus provide her family with a life in which they have everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es ya un profesional recibido que sigue estudiando para poder crecer, ya que es consciente que uno nunca termina de aprender.
Esta haciendo el diplomado de didáctica universitaria, ya que quiere ser maestro y de esa forma poder enseñar a las personas que al igual que yo desean aprender y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de sus estudios, lo que le ayudará a seguir creciendo y mejorando cada vez más. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá mejorar su educación.
texts.en:
Ricardo is already a professional who is continuing to study in order to grow; he knows that one is never done learning.
He is working toward a diploma in university teaching because he wants to be a teacher so that he can teach people who want to learn and succeed like he does.
He is requesting this loan to invest in paying his tuition. This will help him to keep growing and improving. He is grateful for this opportunity, as it will be very helpful for him and he will be able to improve his education.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en: Mishi is a married Kenyan woman who appreciates Kiva for the loan she was given that enabled her pay school fees for her children. Her vision is to expand her maize store to a wholesale shop in order to meet her customers' demands. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase maize sacks for her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance to get access to loan funds with low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase maize sacks for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. For the past two years, she has operated a clothing resale business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. A major challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to establish a boutique business in the future. With the 20,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married, with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bintihamisi has operated a paraffin-selling business for the past two and half years. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of being a supplier to small traders.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase more jerrycans of paraffin to improve her sales. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of paraffin to improve her sales.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is a decent lady. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is 50. She looks after the household while her husband owns an embroidery shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He provides embroidery services in his community. All of his customers appreciate his work and love his embroidered dresses. He needs additional capital to purchase embroidery materials for the shop. Therefore, his wife Sughra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase thread, beads and pearls.
