She hopes that the loan amount will be helpful for her husband's work. Sughra's biggest dream is to provide a quality education to her children. She is feeling happy and satisfied after taking the loan. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread, beads and pearls for her embroidery shop.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Recognizing that pig feed is becoming expensive, Luzviminda decided to apply for a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP. She currently has one sow, and she intends to use the loan she is requesting to buy feed. She will also buy vitamins to maintain the health of her sow. She is hoping that her sow will become healthy and will also bear healthy piglets. Luzviminda believes that with hard work and financial assistance she will make her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a 23-year-old, hard-working woman, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Two years ago, she decided to join the  police force in order to maintain peace in society. She desires to buy land and venture into farming, so as to earn extra income since her salary can hardly meet her needs. 

Aidah is requesting money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is married and has three children. She always wanted to provide them with good education and, since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She works at the hospital, as a nurse, and has a small salary. She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ in a women's organization and got enough skills about business. Her children will help her with her business. She will be a very successful businesswoman since she is hard-working and smart. 

Gulsara is asking for a loan of TJS 500 (somoni) to buy cattle for starting her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for starting a new business.

loans.name: Bohir

texts.ru: Бохир,добрый и порядочный мужчина в возрасте 25 лет. Он занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота. Бохир женат, имеет двоих детей, двоих сыновей. Жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время помогает мужу по откорму скота. На данный момент они имеют 10 голов скота. 8 из них дойные коровы которые дают по 5-6 литров молока каждый день. Его жена производит кисломолочные продукты и продает знакомым и соседям. Они стараются обеспечить своих детей всем необходимым и поэтому трудятся день и ночь. У них очень хороший доход от этого бизнеса. Дополнительно Бохир занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Но основной доход у Бохира от откорма скота.   На данный момент Бохир планирует увеличить поголовье скота, так как скот сейчас дешевле, он хочет до зимы откормить их и ближе к зиме продать их по дороже.  С этой целю он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом и он очень надеется, что его финансово поддержат и помогут.
texts.en:
Bohir is a good and decent 25-year-old man.  He earns his living fattening up livestock.  He is married and has two children, both sons. His wife is a  homemaker but in her spare time she helps her husband feed the animals.  At present they have ten head of cattle, eight of which are milk cows that provide five or six liters of milk per day.  Bohir's wife makes dairy products and sells them to friends and neighbors.  They work night and day, trying to ensure that their children have everything they need.  They have have a very good income from their business.  

Bohir also farms, but his main business is fattening up the cattle.  Right now he is planning to add to his herd because cattle are less expensive.  He wants to fatten them up before wintertime and then sell them close to winter for a higher price, so he is turning to MDO Arvand for a loan. He really hopes they will help and sustain him financially.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: La Esquina  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Esquina está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio, todos son personas amables, gentiles que tienen metas y propósitos pero su objetivo en común es mejora la estabilidad de sus negocios y crecer para salir adelante con su familia. Viven por el sector de Sinincay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999, Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, cuenta con muchos lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es muy trabajadora y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Sonia, forma parte del grupo de crédito La Esquina desde hace 2 años. Tiene 31 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 12, 10 y 6 años, su primer hijo pasa en casa ya que no ingreso al colegio y sus tres hijos siguientes están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a laborar como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Sonia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo al cuidado de su casa y de su hogar, pero como es una mujer luchadora se dedica a la cría de pollos y tiene ganado del cual vende la leche, también se dedica a la  agricultura y lo que cosecha es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar. En su tiempo libre se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla que aprendió de sus padres. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en el alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
The "La Esquina" Group communal bank is made up of ten women and one man. All of them are friendly, nice people who have their own goals and aims. But their common objective is to make their businesses more stable and to get ahead with their families. They live in the Sinincay area of Cuenca, a city also known as Santa Ana of the Four Rivers. It was declared a World Cultural Heritage site in December 1999, thanks to it's beautiful architecture. It has many places to enjoy nature. It's people are gentle and hard-working, who still preserve the culture and traditions of their villages. 

Sonia has been a member of the "La Esquina" group for two years now. She is 31 years old, married and has four children from this union, 13, 12, 10 and 6 years old. The oldest does not study as he did not enter secondary school, the other three continue to study in the local school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They live in their own house. 

Sonia spends most of her time taking care of the house and family. But as the strong woman she is, she raises chickens and has cattle and sells the milk. She also farms and that produce is sold or consumed in their household. In her spare time she weaves Panama hats made out of straw, something she learned from her parents.

The money from the loan will be used to buy pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to make her house bigger.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevos Senderos está formado por 11 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, sus verdes campos y por su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Las socia al igual que toda su gente se caracterizan por ser amables y gentiles que luchan para que sus hogares y sus familias tengan una mejor estabilidad económica para salir adelante.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Paztora, forma parte desde hace algunos años del grupo de crédito Nuevos Senderos, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, le gusta este grupo de crédito por ser un grupo solidario.

La Señora Paztora, tiene 57 años, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos que son mayores de edad, están trabajando y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Paztora desde hace 25 años, se dedica a la venta de café, coladas, ensaladas de frutas y más productos, todos sus productos los vende en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus productos y así continuar en su negocio. 

Su meta es ampliar su negocio, ofrecer más productos y llegar a tener su puesto propio para sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Senderos credit group is made up of 11 women who live in the area around the city of Cuenca. The city is renowned for its beautiful streets, green fields and colonial architecture. Its cuisine is varied and enjoyed by locals and foreigners alike. All of the members are friendly and helpful and they all strive for a better economic stability for their homes and families so they can make progress in life.

Paztora has been one of the members of the Nuevos Senderos group for a few years. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca and she likes the credit group because it is supportive. She is 57 years old and is a widow. She has 4 adult children from her marriage who are working and help her out financially. She does not have her own house so lives in a rented place.

Paztora has been earning a living for the last 25 years selling coffee, fruit juices, fruit salads and other products. She sells her products at a market in the city, working from one Sunday to the next without a fixed timetable. 

She will use the loan to buy supplies for preparing her products and so keep her business going.

Her goal is to expand her business, offer more products and eventually have her own stall for her sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married, and is a father of three children. Ali is the sole provider of his family.

Ali owns a small shop where he specializes in selling pickles. Ali is the only person in the neighborhood with such a profession and, thus, he became well-known in the neighborhood and gained the respect of many. Ali established his business in 2008 and, through practice, he gained much experience in this field.

Ali is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to buy an air conditioner and to install ceramic blocks on the walls and the floor of his shop. Ali believes that this loan will attract more customers and will result in the improvement of his business. He is aiming to continuously grow his business in order to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and to install ceramic blocks on the walls and the floor of his shop.

loans.name: Pilarme

texts.en:
Pilarme is 49 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pilarme runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pilarme has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Pilarme, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru: Бибигул 42-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Хуросон, Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Она заботливая мать двоих дочерей и одного сына. Оба ее дочерей уже окончили школу - им по 19 и 17 лет, а сыну 13 лет и он еще учится. Муж Бибигул уехал на заработки в Россию. С ними также живет ее свекровь, которая является пенсионеркой. Сама Бибигул домохозяйка. Сейчас она хотела бы начать животноводческий бизнес, а именно куплю-продажу крупного рогатого скота. Ее стартовый капитал составляет 650 долларов США, накопленные за счет высланных денег мужа. Чтобы реализовать свою цель Бибигул обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму кредита и сбережения собирается купить 5-голов коров и телят, а также корм скота. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли с деятельности Бибигул хочет провести ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Bibigul is a 42-year-old married woman from the Khuroson region in Khatlon Province, Tajikistan.  She is an attentive mother of two daughters and one son.  Her daughters, ages 19 and 17, have both finished school.  Her son is 13 and still in school.  Her husband has gone to work in Russia.  Her mother-in-law, who is retired, also lives with them.  Bibigul is a homemaker, and now she would like to start a livestock business, namely buying and selling small livestock.  Her starting capital amounts to 650USD, which she has saved from money sent by her husband.  She is seeking a loan to achieve her goal.   Between the loan and her savings she is planning to buy five head of cattle and calves and some cattle feed.  Down the road Bibigul would like to put earnings from the business toward repairs on her house.

loans.use: to buy five head of cows and calves and feed for cattle.

loans.name: Wassa 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe WASSA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Pornobougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme  DIATA  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Wassa 1 Group are married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of three children. They are all living in polygamous families in Pornobougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Diata, shown standing in the center of the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 105,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural labor and seeds.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
la señora flor de María habita en el municipio de condega, un pueblo a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, ella es madre soltera y tiene una hija quien vive con ella en su propia casa de habitación, ella tiene unos 30 años de residir en dicha dirección y es una persona muy conocida.
Ella se desempeña como maestra e imparte clases a alumno de secundaria en el colegio nacional de condega, ella tiene 19 años de desempeñarse como maestra. Ella labora de lunes a viernes de las 7 am a las 12 m y por la tarde ella planea las clases del día siguiente.
Esta clienta se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un financiamiento para la construcción de un servicio sanitario en su casa de habitación, a través del proyecto de agua y saneamiento que lleva ceprodel en conjunto con la alcaldía de este municipio para lo que es el mejoramiento de la salubridad de los pobladores así como las aguas subterráneas con la construcción de este es equipo sanitario que viene a mejorar el modo de vida.
Ella espera que dicho financiamiento sea aprobado y de esta manera optar al proyecto que vendrá a mejorar las condiciones de salud de su familia y darle un valor agregado a su casa de habitación ya que sus ingresos no son los suficiente como para sufragar estos gastos de un solo por su propia cuenta. Ella se muestra positiva y espera ser una beneficiaria más de este proyecto.
texts.en:
Flor de María lives in the town of Condega which is 35 km north of the city of Estelí. She is a single mother and has a daughter who lives with her in her own house. She has been living at the same address for some 30 years and is well-known. She has been a teacher for 19 years and teaches secondary pupils at the national school of Condega. She works Monday to Friday from 7am to 12 noon and in the afternoons she plans her classes for the next day. 

Flor de María visited the Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan to build a bathroom in her home, through the water and drainage project which Ceprodel is carrying out jointly with the town hall. This project aims to improve the public health of the locals since the underground water supply and sanitation facilities will improve the standard of living.

Flor de María hopes the loan will be approved, giving her the option of this project which will improve her family's health and increase the value of her house. Her income is not sufficient to cover the cost of this project herself in one payment. She is keeping positive and hopes she will become another beneficiary of this project.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Xiomara Abigahil

texts.es:
La joven Xiomara Abigahil es Sauceña, a la edad de 23 años ya es casada madre de un niño, se gana el pan de cada día laborando en atención al cliente en el Hospital de la localidad y por la naturaleza de su trabajo ama lo que hace sobre todo porque la gente la cual atiende es humilde y de escasos recursos.
Sueña prepararse como Farmacéutica por eso estudia dicha carrera para tener un mejor futuro ella y su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para pagar este curso con el fin de no tener obstáculos en el futuro para no poder terminar su carrera.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel aprobarán su solicitud donde les agradece por este apoyo incondicional que tienen hacia las personas de escasos recursos de Nicaragua que necesitan de una mano amiga para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Xiomara Abigahil is from El Sauce. She is 23 years old, married and has one child. She earns her living taking care of people at the local hospital. She likes her work, especially since the people she cares for are humble and of marginal income. She dreams of becoming a Pharmacist. So she is studying this in order to have a better future for her and her family. 

She is requesting the present loan to pay for her course so in the future she does not have problems graduating. She hopes and believes in God that the Kiva lenders through Ceprodel approve her loan. She would like to thank them for this wholehearted support for the people of low income of Nicaragua that need a helpful hand to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for her university courses.

loans.name: Jose Herminio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 67 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a su familia, Jose no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito para que estudiara la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquisimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva cacaco, el realiza sus labores de campo todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, abono y cosecha de cultivo, de esta manera Jose espera lograr una buena cosecha de cacao para poder venderla a un buen precio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de comercializar cacao a grandes mercados.
texts.en:
Jose is a 67-year-old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and five children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to provide the best for their family. Unfortunately, because he lacked economic resources and had to work starting when he was very young to help his family, Jose wasn’t able to finish his elementary school studies, which made it impossible for him to get a professional degree in Agronomy, which is what he wanted. In his free time, he likes to walk in the countryside, and sometimes he prepares a delicious fried fish to share with his family.
On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Jose makes his living in agriculture. He has a small plot where he grows cacao. He works in the field every day starting early in the morning, sometimes for about 12 hours. He feels good about his work and believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and the fact that he treats others with kindness.
Jose is very thankful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to cover the costs of irrigating, fertilizing, and harvesting his crop. In this way, Jose hopes to have a good harvest of cacao so that he can sell it at a good price, and thus continue to work and put effort toward achieving his big dream of selling cacao to large markets.

loans.use: to cover the costs of irrigating, fertilizing, and harvesting his crop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 49 años de edad, está divorciada del padre de sus 2 hijos de 17  y  10 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en general, para eso abrió una tienda en su hogar, además vende yucas y da una buena atención a sus clientes.
Empezó con sus ahorros, comprando en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue adquiriendo más productos. Se inicio hace más de 03 años contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención al público. Su negocio le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, al contrario no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le pidan crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan, pero aun así obtiene buenos ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles para su tienda como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 49, is divorced from the father of her two children, ages 17 and 10, with whom she lives in her own house.

Yolanda sells a variety of food, so she opened a store in her house.  She also sells yuca and provides good customer service.  She started with her savings, buying in small quantities.  Later she began acquiring more products.  She started more than three years ago with the help of her son to wait on customers.

Her business allows her to be at home to take care of her small child.  Also, the income helps her buy what she needs for her household.  On the other hand, she doesn't like that some of her customers request credit but get behind when it comes time to pay.  Even so, she earns a good income.

This is her first Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy sugar, rice, oil, and other food products for her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and other food

loans.name: Wassa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe WASSA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Pornobougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme SALI assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Wassa 2 Group are married women with an average age of 41 years and an average of five children. They are all living in polygamous families in Pornobougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Sali, shown seated in the center of the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 110,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural labor and seeds.

loans.name: Wassa 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe WASSA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Pornobougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme  KARY  assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Wassa 3 Group are married women with an average age of 41 years and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Pornobougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Kary, shown seated second from the right the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market and in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 75,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural labor and seeds.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 37 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a medical clinic. He needs medical instruments for the clinic. For that reason, his wife, Rubina, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase medicines and instruments. 

Rubina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is very happy and relaxed after taking out the loan and very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and medical instruments.

loans.name: Sheyla María

texts.es:
Sheyla María es una Sauceña nacida y criada bajo principios y costumbres de gente humilde como todo Sauceño que se caracteriza por su gentileza y hospitalidad.
Es una mujer de 42 años casada, madre de una hija en edad escolar. Desde hace 15 años instaló su negocio con la ayuda de sus padres el cual consiste en una librería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece a los estudiantes y maestros variedad de libros y lapiceros. Este negocio cuenta con la ventaja que hay muy pocos que brindan este servicio en el municipio por lo que es muy concurrido por sus pobladores. Además lo prefieren por la amabilidad de su dueña lo que hace la diferencia de los demás.
Debido a la gran demanda de productos doña Sheyla se presentó a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de lapiceros, cuadernos, cartulinas, papel bond, folder, papelográfos, marcadores acrílicos, lápiz de grafito, lápiz de colores, marcadores permanentes.
Tiene la fé que su solicitud sea aprobada por los inversionistas de Kiva y agradece este gesto de caridad que tienen hacia la gente Nicaragüense.
texts.en:
Sheyla María was born and brought up in El Sauce with the customs and principles of these modest people, who are known for their kindness and hospitality. She is 42 years old and married with a daughter of school age. With the help of her parents she started up her business 15 years ago running a stationery shop in one of the rooms of her house, providing students and teachers with a variety of books and pens. Her business has the advantage of having very little competition in the area and so it gets very busy with local customers. People also prefer the shop because of the friendly owner, which makes it stand out from the others.

Since there is a big demand for Sheyla's products, she approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy pens, notebooks, card, paper, folders, flip charts, acrylic markers, graphite pencils, coloured pencils and permanent markers. She is confident that her loan will be approved by Kiva lenders and is grateful for this act of kindness towards the people of Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy pens, notebooks, card, paper, folders, flip charts, acrylic markers, graphite pencils, coloured pencils and permanent markers.

loans.name: Eddy Job

texts.es: Eddy, es  un joven de 31 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, quien desde los 20 años empezó a trabajar, ahora es ingeniero industrial desempeñándose actualmente en el área de higiene y seguridad ocupacional para una empresa. Su meta es continuar preparándose para salir adelante en la vida y este crédito que solicita es para poder pagar una maestría que está cursando en Salud Ocupacional. Lo cual tiene un costo muy alto comparado a sus ingresos mensuales que son muy bajos, es por eso que acude a solicitar apoyo crediticio para lograr su sueño, lo que le permitiría la posibilidad de mejorar su economía para ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en: Eddy is 31 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He has been working since he was 20 years old and is now an industrial engineer.  He is currently working in the occupational hygiene and security department of a business.  Eddy's goal is to continue working so that he can get ahead in life.  This loan is to pay for a Master's course in Occupational Health, for which he is currently studying.  This course costs more than his monthly income, which is very low and, so, he is applying for a loan in order to achieve his dream.  This will allow him to improve his finances so that he can help his family more.

loans.use: to pay for a Master's course.

loans.name: Maguguni Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Maguguni group was formed in 2009 with an aim of joining efforts to rear chickens. Its members are mainly poultry farmers with only a few cows because their land area is small. They live in a rural area where there is no electricity and there is scarcity of fuel. Without a formal source of livelihood, the group members rely on poultry farming for a large percentage of their income. Some of the members rear layers while others specialize in broilers. On average,a tray of eggs sells for about $2.50, and a single member can produce up to four trays a day. A broiler chicken sells for approximately $3.80, with a single member rearing at least 100 chickens in a month. Money from these sales goes to cater for the chicken feed, payment of school fees as well as taking care of the other family needs.

Solar lamps save on members' fuel costs, such as kerosene, which amounts to  approximately $16 a month. Improved stoves decreases firewood and charcoal usage, which costs a family about $9 a month. Members also find it necessary to use the efficient cook stoves in warming the poultry houses to keep their chicken warm and healthy. 

After receiving training on consumer education and financial management by Visionary Empowerment Programme, the members showed interest in solar lamps and improved cook stoves. Due to family responsibilities and economic constrains, however, they were unable to save upfront for the products and they opted instead to take loans. 

Mary, the group's chair lady, has been using kerosene to light her house and poultry house, and she also uses charcoal to warm the poultry house. With the solar lamps, she no longer has to buy kerosene and charcoal and thus saves money. If she ploughs the amount she saves back to her poultry business, it will lead to growth and business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamps and efficient cook stoves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten more sacks of charcoal and an additional stock of firewood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 43, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, a vendor, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elizabeth operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Elizabeth's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Elizabeth dreams that her business will grow and expand and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Tiempo atrás tomó un curso de belleza con una amiga que tiene un gabinete y de esta forma aprende todo lo relacionado al negocio.  Luego decide ponerse su propio negocio el cual le ha resultado productivo hasta ahora.  Trabaja sola, especialmente durante la tarde y noche.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en una compañía de televisión por cable.  Tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos de belleza para su gabinete.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil’s Orquídeas sector.  Some time ago she took a beauty course from a friend who owns a beauty salon and this is how she learned everything related to this business.  She then decided to open her own business which has had productive results to date.  She works alone, especially evenings and nights.  

She’s married and her husband works for a cable television company.  She has two children attending the local public school.  She needs the loan to buy beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Herlinda

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó su negocio tiempo atrás, cuando se percató que en su sector no había una tienda que vendiera víveres de primera necesidad.  Fue entonces cuando decidió emprender en esta actividad.  Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y tiene buenas ventas.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en el comercio informal.  Tiene 2 hijos que son adultos y tienen ya sus propias familias.  Desea a futuro mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos diarios.  Ahora necesita el crédito para el abastecimiento de su tienda por medio de la compra de víveres.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Libertad.  She started her business some time ago when she noticed that there was no store in her sector selling basic staples.  She therefore decided to go into this business.  She works every day starting very early and her sales are good. 

She’s married and her husband works in the informal commerce sector.  She has two children who are adults now and have families of their own.  

She wants in future to improve her business and increase daily income.  She needs a loan now to stock her store by purchasing food items.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 47, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Antioco and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Virginia hopes to be a wholesaler one day and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has a daughter who is 4 years old and a son who is 3 years old. Mavzuna has a friendly family and she always wanted to spend her time with her children. She must earn a living as her husband has a small income.

She decided to start a new business with animal husbandry because, with this business, she can spend more time with her children. She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got enough skills. She is ready to start a business but she has no money for purchasing cattle. 

Currently she is asking for a loan to buy cattle for organizing a new business. With the business, she will manage alone. 

This is her first loan from Kiva and its field partner IMON. She is thankful in advance for financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
This will be Davit’s second loan from Kiva and here as well as in Nor Horizon he is known as a very responsible client. Davit and his family live in the village Zovaber which is in Gegharkunuk region. His two children are still school-aged. Davit and his wife continue their farming activities and are very happy to provide their family with its income. They breed cows, pigs, sheep and chickens. 

The last loan's aim was the purchase of several cows and animal fodder, and they managed to use the loan to that purpose. This time Davit has plans to buy several piglets and again animal fodder for the winter months and he is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams for that purchase. He says that he feels calm and safe as he knows that he can rely on Kiva lenders’ support if he has any new plans connected with his farm.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and animal fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Eva has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, baskets, fruit, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Eva would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 55-year old married woman living with her spouse and 6 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She belongs to a happy family because her husband earns sufficient income to meet daily household expenses.

Her husband has been running a motor mechanic shop since 1993 in a nearby town. He is very professional and experienced in his work; most of the clients become his close friends and like him to repair their bikes. Her husband is very hard working and honest. He demands very low services charges for his services, so that is why people like him to repair their bikes. Due to his honesty and low rate, he has created a good reputation and goodwill in his community. 

His shop is very tiny and has very low capacity to stand motorbikes for repairing.  Now he wants to expand his shop and merge with the neighborhood shop, but he does not have capital to invest for the expansion.

Irshad requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to expand his shop. Irshad hopes that through the shop expansion more customers will be attracted toward his shop, which will cause an increase in income and savings.

Irhsad has praise for the lenders and is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance and renewal of motorbike

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is an Iraqi youth client who is 25 years old, married and the father of a child.

Karrar owns a small workplace where he tailors shirts of all types on demand. He established his business in 2007 and has gained much experience in this field since he previously used to work as an employee in this field until he established his own independent business. Thanks to his professional tailoring, Karrar gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood and now he has 2 hired employees.

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to install a display window and to renovate his workplace. Karrar is a very ambitious person. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to install a display window and to renovate his workplace

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik and his family live in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. He lives with his wife and two sons. Arayik works as a terminable serviceman and he has  shift work, so at the same time he has his own business. In their house he has a workshop where he makes different kinds of laminate furniture and wooden beds. He sells his ready products to Vanadzor furniture shops. He has been in this business for five years. Sometimes his sons help him if there are a lot of orders and he can not manage alone.

Arayik is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy wood and laminate for his furniture production.

loans.use: to buy wood and laminate for his furniture production

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a daughter and a son.

She has been knitting handmade embroidery at her home for 6 years. The sister of her husband also helps her with the completion of her tasks. Her husband is doing a job in a factory as a laborer; he earns very low wages which are insufficient to meet daily household expenses. She has to prove herself a responsible and brave mother.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Naseem requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She does not want to lose her heart and wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.en:
Hanifamo is 49 years old. She is kind and a smart woman. She lives in a village in the north part of Tajikistan. She lives with her husband and three children. As Hanifamo lives in the country in a village, she decided to organize a business with animal husbandry. There is a good opportunity to develop an animal husbandry business in her region. 

Hanifamo studied at a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. She is very happy now. 

Currently she is asking for a loan to buy cattle and organize her own business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 500 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives in Malindi, Kenya. She sells water, firewood and charcoal for a living. She has been in the business for more than ten years. Halima also owns some rental houses which gives her some extra income. She learnt about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy a stock of charcoal and firewood and repair the water pipes in the her water business. Her vision for the next five years is to own more rental houses since their income is more stable. She is married and blessed with seven children.

loans.use: to buy stock of charcoal, firewood and repair the water pipes

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison runs a café serving food in Kaloleni area near Mariakani area. He is a married man with four children. Harrison is twenty-seven old and he has been in the business for the last four years. He started the business from his own personal savings and the business has grown ever since. 

He learned about Milango through friends at a time when he needed to inject some money into the business. He then joined and now seeks a loan to buy cooking pots, other utensils, and foodstuffs for the business. The challenge in the business is mainly the price of foodstuffs. Sometimes it becomes difficult to price the food he sells. 

Harrison has a vision of opening another café in another town. The extra  income that he raises from the business will be ploughed back until the business is stable enough.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots, other utensils, and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 37 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación, ama de casa, agricultora y comerciante, con 6 años de educación cursando la primaria en su totalidad. Viendo la necesidad de salir adelante tiene un negocio de pulpería el cual es pequeño y vende lo necesario para poder ayudarle a su compañero de hogar a generar ingresos económicos para el sustento de sus hijos. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabaja es propio y está ubicado a 5 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café. 

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos para sus cultivos ya que necesita mantener protegidos de plagas, enfermedades sus cultivos para obtener una buena ganancia al final de la cosecha.

Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos una buena educación a nivel universitario verlos crecer como personas y como profesionales ya que es lo menos que ellos se merecen.
texts.en:
Ana María is 37 years old.  She is mother to three children, two of whom are in different grades in one of the schools in the community.  Ana is a housewife, farmer, and businesswoman.  She has six years of education, having completed primary school.  Seeing the necessity to get ahead in life, Ana has a small grocery store where she sells staple goods.  She needed this business to generate an income to help her partner and support their children.  The land that Ana and her partner work on is their own, and is located five minutes away from their home.  They go there on foot every day to look after their coffee crops.

Ana is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy supplies for her coffee crops.  She needs to keep the plants protected from plagues and diseases in order to make a good profit after the harvest.

Ana's dreams are to give her children a education, up to university level, and to see them grow as people and professionals: this is the least that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Glorifina

texts.en:
Glorifina is 33 years old and lives in Sta. Ana, Cagayan. She is diligently managing a piggery business as her livelihood. Things are going well for her because she provides for the needs of her hogs.  

In the future she wants to build a stronger pen for her hogs. Currently Glorifina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy hollow blocks, cement and additional feed and vitamins for her hogs. She believes that with the loan she will be able to improve her business; thus she is asking Kiva lenders to provide her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy hollow blocks, cement and additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 40 years old and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city. He is married and he has a school-aged son. His wife is unemployed, and she takes care of their son and their house. Armen has received higher education and is an engineer. He is a very clever and resourceful person and he has established a very profitable business. 

Armen has a workshop which produces concrete tiles of different shapes, colors and forms. He sells them to Vanadzor constructional companies. Armen mentions that he manages to provide for his family and he also has plans to enlarge his business.

Armen is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy a large amount of raw materials, since he wants to take several big orders simultaneously.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for large orders

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
Kaed is an Iraqi client, who is 34 years old, married, and has two children. 

Kaed takes care of his family with the profit he gains from his restaurant. He is a very well-known person in the surrounding area. 

In his restaurant, Kaed has a special type of service. His specialty is serving grilled meat. Kaed takes his customers' orders, cuts the fresh meat in front of them, spices it, and grills it in his own special way. He established his business in 2005 and he has gained much experience in this field. Kaed now has two employees and his business is gradually growing, with fame and experience. 

Kaed is requesting a loan of USD 3,000 in order to install a display window and to install ceramic blocks on the floor of his restaurant. He believes that this loan will positively result in the improvement of his current financial conditions since it will attract more customers. Kaed is aiming to take better care of his family, by providing for all of their needs and by educating his children.

loans.use: to install a display window and to install ceramic blocks on the floor of his restaurant.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 42 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Marigen has a store and sells groceries and other consumer products. She is also in the catering business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for purchasing additional goods and other consumer products for retail and more ingredients for her catering business. 
Marigen has been a member of PMPC for the last year. In the future, Marigen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and other consumer products.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 44 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей (1 дочь и 2 сына). Образование-среднее. Роза с 1980 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от животноводства составляет 3,500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Розы, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 5 дойных коров, 25 овец, 2 кобылы, 2 жеребца. Также в наличии имеет 3,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает фасоль и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем хочет купить автомобиль.
texts.en: Roza is 44, married, and has three children (one daughter and two sons).  She has a high school education.  Since 1980 she has earned her living as a rural farmer, raising livestock and growing crops.  She started her business with 12,000KGS.  Her monthly income from the livestock is 3500KGS.   Thanks to her persistent work, nowadays she has on the farm: five milk cows, twenty-five sheep, two mares, and two stallions.  She also started out with 3 1/2  hectares of land where every year she plants beans and perennial grasses.  In order to develop her business more, Roza has turned to "Bai Tulum" communal bank for a loan of 35,000KGS so she can buy a milk cow.  She plans to use income from the loan to further increase the number of cattle she has, and in the future she wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia tiene la edad de 31 años, madre soltera de dos niños. Es una mujer luchadora como toda Sauceña que se caracteriza por salir adelante sin la ayuda del hombre.
A pesar de las dificultades que le ha tocado enfrentar en la vida sobre todo criar sola a sus pequeños hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido construyendo con el esfuerzo propio de su trabajo como secretaria en una Institución de dicho municipio donde tiene muchos años de trabajar.
Tiene muchos sueños en la vida sobre todo ver crecer y preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos por eso le pide a Dios que le brinde salud para cumplir este sueño.
Por tal razón está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con fondos Kiva para mejorar su salud ya que se ha sentido mal en los últimos meses y desea realizar un chequeo médico general con el cual pretende comprar medicamentos, realización de exámenes, ultrasonidos, placas.
Espera y pide el apoyo a estos inversionistas para poder mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Ana Julia, 31, is a single mother of two children.  She’s a hardworking woman like everyone from El Sauce.  She’s notable for getting ahead without a man’s help.

Despite the difficulties she’s had to face in life above all having to raise her little ones alone, she owns her house that she’s been building thanks to her own effort and work as a secretary in an institution in said municipality where she’s been employed for years.

She has many life dreams above all to see her children grow and prepare professionally which is why she prays to God for health so that she can reach this dream.  Because of this, she’s asking Ceprodel for a loan with Kiva funds to improve her health because she’s been feeling poorly these last few months and wants to have a general medical check-up.  

She will use it to pay for medicine, tests, ultrasound and x-rays.  She’s requesting and hoping support from lenders to improve her health.

loans.use: to buy medicine, pay for tests, ultrasound and x-rays.

loans.name: Bartolomea

texts.en:
This is Bartolomea. She previously accessed a PHP 16,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 17,000, for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bartolomea hopes that her business will flourish even more and dreams to have good health and a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Ma.Theresa works very hard to provide for them.
Ma.Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma.Theresa has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 
In the future Ma.Theresa would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a 22-year-old woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the police force for two years and works 12 hours a day. With her meager salary she has been able to save money to invest in farming. Her desire is to venture into mechanized agriculture to diversify her income sources. Moreen intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул, 46 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (3 дочери и 1 сын). Образование-среднее. С 1987 года Майрамкул занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 8,000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает по хозяйству. 3 дочери вышли замуж и проживают отдельно, сын работает и помогает своей семье материально. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 лошади, 4 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 15 коз и 2 теленка. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Майрамкул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем Майрамкул планирует построить дом.
texts.en: Mairamkul, 46, is married and has four children (three daughters and one son).  She has a high-school education.  Since 1987 she has made her living in livestock, having started the business with 5000KGS.  Her monthly income is 8000KGS.  Her husband helps out on the farm.  Three of her daughters are married and live elsewhere.  Her son works and helps the family financially.  Thus far Mairamkul has been able to develop her livestock business.  On the farm she has: two horses, four milk cows, twenty sheep, fifteen goats, and two calves.  In order to expand the farm further, she has turned to "Bai Tulum" communal bank for a loan of 70,000KGS to buy two cows.  She plans to use the income from the loan to buy more heads of cattle, and in the future she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crops.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña María Vicenta es una mujer luchadora, feliz de 30 años de edad con un grado de escolaridad de secundaria completo y madre de 2 hijos el mayor de 8 años y está en la primaria y la segunda de 2 años los cuales dependen de ella. Ella es Viuda ya que su esposo murió hace unos años desde entonces su única compañía son sus hijos con los cuales cuenta incondicionalmente. Ella es agricultora y fue su esposo quien en vida le enseño a trabajar la tierra en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de papa, frijoles y maíz. El terreno que ella cultiva es propio el cual pudo adquirir junto a su esposo en vida ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ella cultiva; por lo cual, esto a ella le facilita dar el mantenimiento para que sus cultivos siempre estén sanos y libres de plagas.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla de papa certificada, abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos para poder elaborar y cultivar un producto sano y seguro.      

Sus metas son poder cultivar papa de calidad con la cual ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias y mejores ingresos para ella y para sus hijos ya que de esa manera ella podrá re-invertir en sus cultivos y poder cumplir con su compromiso y seguir gozando de estos beneficios. Como madre su sueño es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible con la cual ellos puedan implementar en su vida y en su trabajo el conocimiento obtenido en la universidad y el conocimiento obtenido en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
María Vicenta is a feisty and happy woman.  She is 30 years old and completed primary school.  She is a mother to two children: the oldest is eight years old and in primary school, while the youngest is two years old.  Both are still dependent on their mother.  María is a widow and, since her husband died some years ago, she has had only her children for company.  She counts on them unconditionally.  María is a farmer, her husband having taught her to work the land.  María sows and grows potatoes, beans and corn.  She works her own land as she was able to buy it with her husband when he was alive.  It is easy for her to look after her crops and so they are always healthy and free from plagues.

María is currently applying for help to buy certified potato seeds, manure, fertilisers and other supplies in order to grow healthy and safe crops.

María's goal is to be able to grow quality potatoes, with which she will be able to earn higher profits and increase her income for her and her children.  With these extra profits, she will be able to reïnvest in her crops, repay her debt and continue to enjoy these profits.  As a mother, María's dream is to give her children the best possible education that they can later apply in their lives and in their work.  She hopes that they will be able to use what they learn both at home and at university.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds and supplies for potato crops.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 47 years old and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a mother of four children and is married to Rufo, a plumber. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a buy and sell business. What she does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 41,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional stocks of supplies and products like an electric fan, a TV, a rice cooker, an amplifier, DVD players and Tupperware products needed in her business.

Lilibeth hopes to have a stall for her business and dreams to be a successful businesswoman. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products like an electric fan, a TV, a rice cooker, an amplifier, DVD players and Tupperware products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cheer

texts.en:
Cheer is 48 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. Cheer has a store and sells groceries and other consumer products. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional goods and other consumer products for retail. 

Cheer has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Cheer hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and other consumer products for retail.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive con su esposo e  hijo en  la comunidad Urco Corral Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolvar.

María  se dedica a la venta de comida y a la agricultura de maíz papas, y otros. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado como: ovejas, vacas

Las  compras lo realizan en Guaranda cada semana. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá cubrir sus nececidades. 

Su desafo son los fenómenos naturales. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y arreglar la casa.  

En el tiempo libre  le gusta bailar y visitar a la familia.
texts.en:
María is 54, married, and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and one son in the community of Urco Corral in Chillanes Canton in Bolivar Province. María works selling food and as a farmer, growing corn, potatoes, and other crops. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase livestock such as sheep and cows. María makes weekly purchases of livestock in Guaranda. This loan will allow María to meet her needs. Nature presents challenges to María's farming, but her dream is to purchase land and set up her home. 

María likes to dance and visit her family in her spare time.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old, has four children and is married to a driver. Maricel's husband drives a trailer truck for one of the companies in their region. To gain profits, Maricel bought a motorcycle and operates it with someone whom she trusts and from whom she receives daily rents (boundary) for it. 

Maricel wants to have an additional source of income because her children's needs and fees for school increased. In this connection, Maricel wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase new spare parts and repaint her tricycle sidecar. She also plans to purchase tires, accessories for her motorcycle to encourage more passengers leading to more income as well.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts and repaint her tricycle sidecar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has two children. Anwar provides for his family's living with the profit that he gains from his grocery while his wife takes care of their children. 

In his grocery store, Anwar provides the basic daily supplies of his neighborhood such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, shampoos and detergents. He established his business in 2000 and has gained good experience in this field. He is a well-known person in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Anwar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator and to increase his inventory of goods to sell. Anwar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and to increase his  inventory of goods to sell

loans.name: Tin

texts.en:
Tin is 32 years old and married with two children. She owns around a four-hectare farmland where she grows rice, cassava, beans, and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She and her spouse have been doing this for years and earn a net profit of KHR 13,000 per each a day to provide basic needs for their family members.

Tin needs a loan to pay laborers for weed removal and buy farming materials to apply on her cassava fields. She has been with HKL for two loan cycles and she has successfully paid off her loans. The profits from her harvest, will be used to support her family and educate her children.

loans.use: to pay laborers for weed removal and buy farming materials to apply on her cassava fields.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Repairing machines and cars is Danilo’s business, and he also sells surplus machines for extra income. Two helpers in his shop make his service fast and efficient.

To meet customr demand, Danilo is requesting a loan of Php 50,000 to buy farm machines, some car tools and machine supplies. He hopes to further expand his enterprise to achieve even greater success in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm machines, some car tools, and machine supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with three children. All her three children attend school. She sells secondhand clothes at the local market. She has done this business for the last ten years. She also owns a pool business which earns her extra income. She found out about Milango through friends and she now seeks a loan to buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell. She has had previous loans from Milango which were not listed on Kiva and she paid them back without challenges. The challenge she faces in this business is price changes. Inflation also affects her income from the business and these are the challenges that she has to deal with. The extra income that she will raise from the loan use will help her pay school fees for her children. Her living standard will also improve. She has a vision of selling clothes as a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 30-year-old, married woman, with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For 13 years, she has been a teacher and, with her salary, she has been able to build rental houses, where she earns extra income. Delayed salaries and tenants being reckless with her houses are her major challenges.

Annet intends to use the loan to renovate her rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda is 30 years old. She is divorced and has no children. She always wanted to organize her own business selling food items, but she had not the skills about business or the financial support for organizing a business. Since she studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women organization, she got more information about business. 

Mahsuda is going to start business selling food items in the local market. She will manage this business alone. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somonis to buy food items for organizing this new business. From the profit, she plans to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merly is 31 years old and married with one child.  Merly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merly has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Levinah

texts.en: Levinah is a twenty-two-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been a police officer for two years and works twelve hours a day.  A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university and renovate her house despite challenges of a low salary and poor working conditions.  Levinah intends to use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Florgie

texts.en:
Florgie is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Florgie  is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her rice farming business.

Florgie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Florgie hopes to support her immediate family members.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a farmer who lives in Magsaysay, Balingao. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. To make a living, she grows rice to sell. Virginia has been doing this activity for more than 20 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3000. She is also a reflexologist and a faith healer.
 
Virginia has requested a loan to finance her rice production, particularly in purchasing fertilizer and paying expenses for rice field preparation.

Virginia has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since August 23, 2004.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and prepare her rice field

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 45 years old and lives in Tuburan District, Pagadian City. She is married with four children.

Jovita has a shop that sells home products such as fresh vegetables and canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan to be used as additional capital for her little store business.

Jovita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jovita hopes to make her little store into a bigger convenience store.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
At the age of 43, Liberty dreams to have a four-wheel car that can be used in her business.  Liberty manages a gravel and sand business with her husband in their village. Her husband leads their three helpers in making hollow blocks.  This is her husband's expertise.   He has been doing that since he was still single and continues when they got married. The couple has three children attending school. Through their earnings in the business, Liberty is able to provide her children enough school allowances. 

To buy cement, sand and other materials needed in their business, Liberty requested a PHP 30,000 loan from KIVA lenders. Through this loan, Liberty hopes to improve the business and wishes to encourage more customers and gain more profits as well.

loans.use: buy cement for her block-making business

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Faragis is a wonderful young lady. She is 19 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. She always wanted to be successful in business.  

Farangis is going to start a business selling food items. She is going to organize her business in the local market. Her mother will help her with the business.  She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women organization. 

Faragis is asking for a loan of 2000 Somonis to buy food items to sell. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Mukama Yemubeezi Kisunku Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a married woman with three children. She is twenty five years old. Teddy is a member of Mukama Wemubezi Kisunku group, which has nine members. This is her third loan cycle.  She has received a loan of 500,000, 1,000,000 and 1,000,000 UGX respectively.

Teddy is a business woman who deals in a retail shop trading selling daily household use items.  She works seven days a week and each day she works for seventeen hours. She has been in this business since 2009.  She started this business with the aim of supplementing her husband’s family income. She sells her products to residents in rural setting.

Teddy has acquired this loan so that she can purchase more daily household use items which are usually consumed by her customers. Her hopes are to expand her business to the level of wholesale trading and to set up more outlets on the outskirts of her town.

Teddy’s challenges are delay of payments by customers who took goods on credit and lack of enough capital to finance her business.  She describes herself as an honest and hard-working lady and asks lenders to continue extending their services to the local people so that they can develop themselves.

loans.use: buy household goods to resell

loans.name: Noor Jahan

texts.en:
