Thelma works hard to support five children. She is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 7,850 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Thelma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Wody

texts.en:
Wody is 42 years old and she has five children, three of whom are in school.

Wody works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Wody requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy household goods to sell like chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Wody has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Wody aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell like chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Leoniel

texts.en:
Leoniel, a 26-year-old, is a married entrepreneur from San Roque, Panaon. He earns money from his transport service business, which he has operated for more than three years now. He earns about 5,000 PHP a month. 

He also has a shop offering repair services where he sells engine oil, accessories and supplies. To improve his business, Leoniel is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined in 2011, to buy accessories, engine oil and tires for resale. He hopes to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to buy accessories, engine oil and tires for resale.

loans.name: Mary Glenn

texts.en: Mary Glenn is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children. To earn a living, she makes and sells food in her cafeteria. She has been engaged in this business for more than 3 years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month from it. Mary Glenn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Sokun is a 32-year-old married mother of three children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for several years. To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband also works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 15,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 5,000KHR each day for future needs. 
Sokun’s group consists of six members who live in the same village. She is the first cycled client with VisionFund and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Sokun, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes to have a clean latrine so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a decent latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 37 years old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Clarita works very hard to provide for her family.

Clarita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 18 years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, spices, noodles, detergent soap, bread, etc. 

Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 45 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

Liberty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.

Liberty has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Liberty aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock for the store, like coffee, spices, and soap. Lucia has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling rice.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, spices, and soap.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 49 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mercedes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, bottled water, spices, and canned goods. She has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, bottled water, spices, and canned goods.

loans.name: Thioro's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé  le 16 juin 2011 il est constitué de vingt femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme principales activités le petit commerce, l'agriculture et l'élevage. Madame Awa l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Elle s'active dans le commerce de de chaussures,sacs et produits cosmétiques.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite vêtue de mauve et a levé la main gauche.

Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar et à Touba en parfums, lait de beauté, chaussures, sacs, pochettes....pour revendre dans son village.
Avec son prêt elle compte investir tout le montant reçu de 70 000 F pour mieux développer son activité. 


 Avec les bénéfices elle renforce son épargne et appui son mari dans la gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
This group has been created on June 16, 2011. It consists of 20 women living in the same village. Their main business activities are retail, farming and raising livestock. Mrs. Awa, the star borrower, is 39 years old. She is married and does not yet have children. She sells shoes, bags and cosmetic products. On the photo is standing on the right dressed in purple and raising her left hand.

She stocks up in Dakar and Touba on perfume, body milk, shoes, bags, plastic pouches etc in order to resell in her village. With this loan, she plans to invest the total of 70,000 West African francs in order to better develop her business. With these revenues, she will bolster her savings and help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 53-year-old, married woman, with six children. She lives with her family in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

To earn a living, her husband works as a chain saw operator for a private industry. In order to help her husband generate income, Marcelina manages a plot of vegetable garden, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy fertilizer and a new variety of vegetables. Marcelina is hopeful that this loan will improve her farm and the general living situation of the family, as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a new variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, and spices. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Darlyn is 49 years old and has five children who are in school.

Darlyn has a dress-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her dress-making business.

Darlyn has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 43 years old and married.

Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles, milk, coffee, and soap.

Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the general store for 3 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Salvacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles, milk, coffee, and soap.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 46 años y es casada de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde expende platos típico de la región como por ejemplo caldo de gallina, malaya frita, pescado frito y otros, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, verduras, latas de leche, bolsas de fideos y botellas de aceite, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Concepción was born in the town of Paucartambo where she still lives. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She is a hardworking, enterprising person who works hard to help her family get ahead. 

Concepción owns a small restaurant where she serves local dishes such as chicken soup, fried steak, fried fish etc.

She has belonged to the Virgen del Rosario Community Bank for several years and now needs a loan to buy ingredients such as bags of rice and sugar, vegetables, cans of milk, bags of noodles, and bottles of oil. Concepción is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to pay back the money in monthly installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, vegetables, milk, noodles and oil

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.en: Maria Clara is 43 years old and married. She sells fish in their community to earn a living. Her husband worked as a fisherman. She has been doing this for nine years. In 2011, she became a member of Gata Daku MPC and recently borrowed a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to buy new fishing nets. She hopes to be able to get another fishing boat to be used for her fishing business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old and single. 

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail charcoal business for three years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Margarita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en:
Denisa works hard to support her family. Denisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Denisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, eggs, and fabric conditioner. She has been in this business for three years now.

Denisa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, eggs, and fabric conditioner.

loans.name: Maria Elizabet

texts.es:
María Elizabet con una edad de 39 años es agricultora y madre de 5 hijos la cual está muy contenta y orgullosa por los resultados obtenidos en su primer financiamiento el cual pudo cumplir con seriedad y responsabilidad solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL ya que ella pudo comprar insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café. Los resultados fueron favorables ya que su producto fue muy atractivo en el mercado por su color, su sabor y su precio competitivo. 

Nuevamente solicita un segundo financiamiento a nuestra institución con el cual pretende seguir asistiendo sus cultivos de café los cuales darán cosecha en los próximos meses y su propósito es asegurar nuevamente su plantación protegiéndola de plagas, bichos entre otros, para seguir trabajando de la misma forma que anterior mente lo hizo de esa manera ella podrá hacer atractivo sus cultivos para los compradores finales los cuales hacen posible que ella siga siendo una mujer emprendedora y luchadora.
texts.en:
María Elizabet is 39 years old. She is a farmer and mother of five children. She is very pleased with the results of her first loan with COMIXMUL which she fulfilled with a sense of responsibility. She got a loan so that she could buy agricultural supplies to provide maintenance and technical assistance for her coffee crops.The results were favorable, given that her harvest was well received in the market for it's color, taste and competitive price. 

María Elizabet is requesting a second loan with COMIXMUL in order to continue caring for her crops which will be harvested in the next few months. Her plan is to assure that her plantation is protected from infestations, insects etc. and continue working as she did last time. In this way she can produce a crop which is attractive to the buyers. She continues to be an enterprising woman and a fighter.

loans.use: to provide maintenance and technical assistance for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Julita works hard to support her family.

Julita has a grocery store business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.  Julita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her grocery store business, like chips, canned goods, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like chips, canned goods, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, a 51-year-old widowed mother of three children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a vegetable and fruit vending business in the Philippines for seven years, she has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount NWTF to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell.

Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco se dedica al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace  2 años.
Don Marco cuenta con una pequeña caseta de madera ubicada en la calle principal de su comunidad, contando con los clientes de la zona y personas que viajan a diferentes aldeas, ya que esperan el bus junto a su negocio y el aprovecha la oportunidad para vender su producto.
Don Marcos inicia su negocio con la necesidad de salir adelante y poder formar su propio patrimonio gracias a la buena administración  ha podido darle los estudio a sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda y comprar lo necesario para vivir de una manera honesta y Humilde.
Don Marcos solicita el apoyo del préstamo para surtir su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, leches, aguas, pan, churros, papel higiénico, etc. y poder cubrir con la demanda de producto a sus clientes,  sueña con tener un local más grande y trabajar junto a su esposa para poder vender golosinas y mejorar sus ingresos.


Danlí, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Marco has been selling groceries for the last two years in his general store. This is his main source of money. His small wooden house is located on the main street of his community, beside the bus stop. Marcos says that customers from his area and people traveling to different villages take the opportunity to shop while they are waiting for their buses.Marco started his business as he needed a way to get ahead. Through good management he has been able to build up his assets, send his children to school, improve his house and buy what he needs to live in a honest and humble way. 

Marco is requesting this loan to stock his store, buying rice, sugar, milk, water, bread, churros, toilet paper, etc. so he can meet the needs of his customers. He dreams of having a bigger store and working with his wife to sell candies and increase their revenue.

Danlí, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, water, bread, churros, toilet paper, etc for his business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en una casa alquilada de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella únicamente hizo estudios hasta nivel de primaria. Se dedica a la venta de condimentos y al tejido de mantas, de esa manera colabora para mantener el hogar con su marido que se encuentra trabajando para un sindicato. 
Necesita crédito para poder iniciar su proyecto de tejido de ropa deportiva para niños que es un negocio más rentable que tejer mantas.
El sueño de Mery es abrir un gran taller donde pueda tejer todo tipo de prendas
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito mediante KIVA.
texts.en:
Mery is married with 2 children and lives in a rented house in the city of El Alto. She has only had primary level education. She earns a living selling condiments and weaving blankets and so is able to help her husband with the household running costs. He works for a trade union. 

This is the first time Mery has asked for a loan from Kiva. She needs a loan so she can start her project of weaving fabric for casual clothing for children, which is a more profitable business than weaving blankets.

Mery's dream is to open a big workshop where she can weave all kinds of clothing.

loans.use: to start a project weaving fabric for casual clothing for children.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es soltera, no tiene hijos, colabora con los gastos familiares ya que vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella pudo terminar la secundaria, continúa trabajando como empleada en una empresa de transportes de El Alto.
Necesita crédito para comprar material de construcción como azulejos, un lavamanos, y otros materiales que le permitan mejorar el baño de su domicilio que se encuentra bastante deteriorado.
El sueño de Silvia es refaccionar por completo el lugar donde vive para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia’s single and has no children.  She helps cover family expenses because she lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto.  She was able to complete secondary school and continues working as an employee for a transportation firm in the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan to buy building supplies like tile, a sink and other materials that will make it possible for her to improve the bathroom at home which is quite deteriorated.  Silvia’s dream is to completely redo the place where she lives in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make improvements to her bathroom at home.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es casada, tiene dos hijos y domicilio propio en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como abogada, el esposo tiene un empleo en un Ministerio. La pareja hizo construir un departamento con sus ahorros pero el lugar esta incompleto, carece de puertas y de un baño completamente equipado, por eso necesitan el crédito, para terminar de construir su hogar y darle comodidad a los hijos
texts.en:
Sandra is married with two children and has her own home in La Paz.

She currently works as an attorney and her husband works in a government Ministry. The couple built an apartment with their savings, but it is incomplete. It lacks doors and a fully equipped bathroom. They need the loan to complete construction on their home and provide comfort to their children.

loans.use: to buy doors and bathroom fixtures for her apartment.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom is in school, works very hard to provide for her family. For 10 years now she has run a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, eggs, etc.

In the future Geraldine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Javier

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Inició con esta actividad por la necesidad de tener un negocio propio que le genere un ingreso económico.  Recibió un dinero y pronto decidió comprarse un taxi, con el cual ha trabajado hasta la fecha.  Es soltero pero tiene 3 hijos, de 2, 13 y 15 años; los 2 últimos están estudiando en el colegio fiscal.  Desea a futuro poder construir su casa en un terreno que tiene.  Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de repuestos para su carro (llantas).
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Quevedo.  He started this activity because he needed to have a business of his own that would generate income for him.  He got some money and quickly decided to buy a taxi that he’s been working with ever since.

He’s single but has three children who are 2, 13 and 15 years of age; the two older ones attend public school.  He hopes in future to be able to build his house on a lot he owns.  He wants to use the loan to buy spare parts for his car (tires).

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años vive junto a su esposo Albino, con quien tiene 2 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura; actividad que realiza desde niña y cuando formó su familia se independizó gracias a los terrenos agrícolas que heredó de sus padres, donde siembra papa, maíz y alverja, cuenta con terrenos con riego por lo que no tiene problemas con el agua y esto le ayuda a poder sembrar durante todo el año. Pero como la agricultura le deja ganancias después de muchos meses a la espera de la cosecha a comenzado a criar animales y comercializarlos cuando esten grandes; por lo que ahora tiene vacas y ovejas que le proporcionan un ingreso adicional y permanente. Ahora lo que desea es mejorar la calidad de su ganando y tener mayor cantidad para poder negociar con los carniceros que siempre visitan su casa para comprar sus animales. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rosa, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives with her husband Albino and their 2 children in their own house. Rose earns a living from agriculture and has been doing this since she was young. When she started her own family she became independent thanks to the agricultural land which she inherited from her parents. She grows potatoes, corn and peas on her land which is irrigated, so there is no problem with lack of water and she is able to plant all year round. 

However, since the profits from her crops only come after many months of waiting for the harvest, she has started rearing animals to sell when they are bigger. Now she has cows and sheep which give her a permanent additional income. What she wants now is to improve the quality of her livestock and have a larger number so she can negotiate with the butchers who always come to her house to buy her animals. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is being given and promises to pay her instalments punctually. Rosa will use the 500 soles to buy sheep to increase the size of her flock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 43 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor en la casa que heredó de sus padres. La principal actividad económica de Alicia, consta de la siembra de hortalizas y verduras combinado con papa, pues los terrenos agrícolas que posee son propicios para este tipo de siembra. El río caudaloso que pasa por sus terrenos la ayuda a mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos pues tiene agua constante. Ahora desea incrementar sus ingresos pues quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas y sembrar en mayor cantidad para ello utilizará su negocio de compra y venta de ganados, que es donde también obtiene buenos ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alicia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 43, is an unassuming woman.  She lives in the company of her three children who she cares for with much love in the house she inherited from her parents.  

Alicia’s main economic activity is growing vegetables and produce in addition to potatoes because the farmland she owns is apt for this type of crop.  The fast-flowing river that passes by her land helps her improve the quality of her food because she has a constant source of water.

Now, she’d like to increase her income because she wants to buy farmland and grow larger amounts and will use income from her cattle business to do so since she also earns good income this way.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the economic support received and promises to make her payments punctually.  Alicia will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analie works hard to support her family. She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes (RTW), in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fishing.

Analie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional clothing to sell, for her RTW business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Bayanmongol

texts.en:
Mr. Bayanmongol, 32 years old, lives with his sister, brother and brother-in-law, in the capital city of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar. He has been making, repairing and dealing in jewelry for three years, and he has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. His sister teaches at a kindergarten, and his brother-in-law renders taxi service to local people for a living.

Bayanmongol is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT. He will use this amount to purchase silver and other raw materials that he needs for making jewelry. As a result of the loan, he will be able to continue to make and sell jewelry without worrying about a raw materials shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase silver and other raw materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 48 años vive en compañía de su esposo Benjamin y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Victoria se dedica a la agricultuta y como todas las mañanas junto al primer rayo de sol se dirige a cuidar sus sembríos y tambien aprovecha en sacar a los animales al campo, que es la otra actividad económica a la que se dedica. Cuenta que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe de la agricultura es por esa razón que ahora es una de las principales actividades a la que se dedica junto a su esposo quien también proviene de padres agricultores, sus sembríos constan de papa, habas, maíz y alverja los cuales vende a buen precio pues gracias al río que bordea su pueblo pueden tener alimentos de calidad. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Victoria, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Victoria, 48, lives in her own house in the company of her husband, Benjamín, and their four children.  Victoria works in agriculture and every morning at daybreak she heads out to care for her crops and also to take her animals out to pasture which is another economic activity she does.

She relates that since childhood her parents taught her everything she knows about agriculture which is why today it’s one of the main activities she and her husband carry out; he also comes from agricultural parents.  Her crops consist of potato, lima beans, corn and peas that she sells at good prices because thanks to the river that borders her town they are able to produce good quality food items.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona, de 36 años vive en compañía de su esposo Francisco y sus 4 pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y alverja los cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues depende mucho de los cuidados que reciben las cultivos para la calidad de alimentos que madurará. Es así que gracias al apoyo de su esposo puede dedicar su tiempo a nutrir y fertilizar sus cultivos, pues también cuenta con una pequeña tienda de comestibles cerca de la escuela de su pueblo que le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos así como la crianza de animales menores. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos para poder negociarlos a un mayor precio y eso lo conseguirá con la ayuda del abono orgánico que necesita la planta de manera constante. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Simona, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Simona, 36, lives in her own house in the company of her husband, Francisco, and their four young children.  Her main crops are potato, lima beans and peas that she cares for with much dedication because the quality of the food that will ripen very much depends on the care the crops receive.

This is why thanks to her husband’s support she’s able to spend her time nourishing and fertilizing her crops because she also has a small food store near her town’s school that helps her improve her income and so does raising small animals.

Now, she’d like to improve the quality of her crops so that she can sell them at a higher price and she will be able to do this with help from the organic manure the plants need constantly.  

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the economic support received and she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Simona will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Jardin Del Eden 2013 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento JARDIN DEL EDEN 2013 Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Amada en la foto (primera desde la derecha sentada, Chaleco blanco y blusa negra) tiene 51 años, viuda tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en zona Primero de Agosto ,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Amada va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que es época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra.  Amada enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de ropa para seguir incrementando su capital d etrabajo, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra.  Amada se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jardin del Eden 2013 has nine members whereof seven women and two men. Its chairperson is Amada who appears in the photo seated to the right, wearing a white blouse and a black top. She is 51 years old, widowed, and has six adult children. She works selling clothes according to the season. She sells her products in her stall, which is located in the Primero de Agosto area. 

This is Amada's first loan with this institution, and she will use it to buy clothes in bulk such as sweaters and jackets, this being the cold season. During this season she sells a lot and gets a lot of orders. The reason why she is applying for this loan is lack of capital. The constant competition is a challenge to Amada's business. She will use this benefit to purchase a variety of clothes in order to continue increasing her working capital. 

Her wish is to have a lot of merchandise in stock so that she can offer her clients a variety of products. Amada feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered her, since this allows her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk such as sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 67 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Luciana runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal and bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell for her business.

Luciana has been in this business for 15 years. Luciana earns additional income from food vending.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Catherine works hard to support her family.

She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from trucking transport. Catherine is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional recycled materials to sell for her recycled materials business.

Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Peruanos A Trabajar Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “PERUANOS A TRABAJAR”. Una de ellas es la Sra. Angélica de 41 años de edad soltera  y madre de 3 hijos, la Sra. Angélica es una mujer muy emprendedora que gracias  a sus esfuerzos a sabido superarse, la Sra. Ánglica tiene una pequeña bodega en un pequeño local , el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar productos(arroz,azúcar,menestras etc) para su bodega y así generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener mas ingresos económicos y poder apoyar la educación de sus hijos. La Sra. Angélica es la segunda persona esta parada para la mano izquierda se le distingue por su chompa de color  rosada, la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva,sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
The Peruanos A Trabajar communal bank is comprised of eight members who are enterprising women with a lot of business related creativity.  Angélica, age 41, is one of the members.  She is single and has three children.

Angélica is a very enterprising woman who, thanks to her efforts, has known how to excel.  Angélica has a small store in a little place.  It is her only source of income for herself and her family.

She will use the loan that was granted to buy products (rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.) for her grocery store.  This way she will generate income for later sales.  She will also be able to have more income and be able to pay for her children’s education.

Angélica is standing, and she has on a pink jacket.  She is very grateful for the help provided.  She says good-bye with a strong hug for Kiva, knowing that she will meet all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica, de 46 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Teofilo, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Angelica se dedica a la agricultura y los terrenos agrícolas que posee son muy fértiles y se encuentran rodeados de un riachuelo que proviene del cerro, por ello no tiene dificultad en la siembra de papa, maíz, alverja y habas, pues los riega, cuida y siembra durante los 12 meses del año. Angelica afirma ser muy dichosa pues cada temporada de cosecha recibe buenas ganancias. Además de dedicarse a ello también cría animales como vacas y ovejas las cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues los comercializa de manera constante. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus sembríos, “cada año los precios se encuentran bajando por lo que mis alimentos tienen que ser mejores en calidad, para vender a un mayor precio”, afirma. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Angelica, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Angelica is a modest 46-year-old woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Teofilo. They have 5 children but only 2 of them live with them. Angelica works in agriculture and her plots of agricultural land are very fertile and are surrounded by a stream which comes from the hillside. This means she has no difficulties growing potatoes, corn, peas and broad beans and she sows, waters and looks after them all year round. Angelica says she is very happy as she gets good profits each harvest time. As well as this she rears animals such as cows and sheep and looks after them with great care so she can always sell them.

Now she wants to improve the quality of her crops, saying: "every year the prices get lower so my food crops need to be of a higher quality so I can sell them at a better price."

This is her second loan with Kiva  and she is grateful for the financial support she has received which will allow her to increase her income. She promises to be punctual in paying the instalments. Angelica will use the 1500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana nació en la ciudad de Saylla pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 68 años y es viuda pero tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida donde expende diferentes platos  típicos de la región como por ejemplo, arroz con huevo, pescado frito, caldo de gallina, malaya frita y otros, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, latas de leche, bolsas de fideos y botellas de aceite y otros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Maximiliana was born in the city of Saylla but now lives in the city of Paucartabmo.  She is 68 years old and a widow, though she has four children. Maximiliana is a hard-working and enterprising mother who, through her effort at work, is getting her family ahead.  Maximiliana has a business selling meals.  She offers different, typical dishes from the region, including rice with egg, fried fish, chicken broth, and fried steak. Maximiliana has belonged to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank for a number of years.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy supplies such as bags of rice and sugar, tins of milk, pasta, and bottles of oil.  Maximiliana is grateful for and values this loan.  She promises to be responsible and make her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bags of rice and sugar, tins of milk, pasta, and bottles of oil.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married. She has four children. Elsa works hard to provide for her family, running her general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 25 years, and she earns additional income from rice retailing.

She has requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, and noodles. Elsa has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is widowed and has a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 37 years old and married with two children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles and eggs.

Anita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles and eggs.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile works hard to support her family. Cecile is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil, etc.  Cecile has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Cecile would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been knitting handmade embroidery at home for six years. Her three daughters and she herself also helps him for the completion of his tasks. Her husband had been driving an auto rickshaw in the past but it crashed due to an accident. But he did not loose heart and proved himself a responsible and brave father.  In six years he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.
To cope with the increasing demand of customers, Nasreen requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.
She does not want loose heart and wants to pay for all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for handmade embroidery.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a handwoven mat business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her handwoven mat business. Elsie has been in this business for 20 years. Elsie earns more income from buying and selling bananas.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertiilzers and other farm supplies. Erlinda has been farming sugarcane for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elver

texts.es: Elver es transportista, vive y trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz. Su ocupación laboral hace que exponga su vida hasta altas horas de la noche, pero es la única manera que tiene para sobrevivir. Necesita crédito para reparar su movilidad y hacerle mantenimiento. Con el tiempo, Elver espera ser propietario de una casa para dar más estabilidad a su esposa e hijos
texts.en: Elver is a taxi driver and lives and works in the city of La Paz.  As a result of his work, he is out and about until late into the night, but this is the only way Elver can survive.  He needs this loan to repair and maintain his vehicle.  With time, Elver hopes to own his own house in order to give his wife and children more stability.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: Ronal es conductor de radio taxi y vive en la ciudad de La Paz, tiene siete hijos pero esta separado de la esposa. Su ocupación lo mantiene alejado de su familia porque debe trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Necesita crédito para reparar y hacer un mantenimiento de su vehiculo, pues es su única herramienta de trabajo
texts.en:
Ronal is a radio taxi driver and lives in the city of La Paz. He has seven children but is separated from his wife. His job keeps him apart from his family because he has to work late into the night. 

He needs a loan in order to repair and carry out maintenance on his vehicle, since it is his only means of earning a living.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Styla

texts.en:
Styla is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two young children who are fully dependent upon her. Styla's house is under construction and she does not have funds to complete the remaining construction. Her husband owns a clothing business, buying fabric from wholesalers and selling it to the retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy fabric from him. Sometimes he purchases fabric from out of the city at low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has good reputation in the market and his current customers help him advertise to other retailers by word of mouth.
Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day but he does not have sufficient funds to buy more fabric.
Therefore, Styla requested a loan of 65,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more fabric to fulfill the demand.
She is on her seventh loan and has shown an excellent repayment record. She has taken loans from BRAC and invested in the business. Styla hopes that the savings will much increase and she will complete the remaining construction of her house. 
Styla dreams of a bright future for her children and establishing the business to improve the family's living standard.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es: La Sra. Silvana  tiene 31 años, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Plan 3000,  ella no tiene un puesto fijo por lo que ambula vendiendo su pan por toda la zona,  es cliente que se encuentra en su primera secuencia dentro de la institución , La Sra. Silvana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un  horno de mayor capacidad ya que el que tiene no satisface la demanda que tiene ya que es muy conocida por la zona e incremento su clientela y por ende sus ventas, La Sra. Silvana  es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, su deseo con el tiempo es poder tener una tienda donde ofrecer sus productos y también  dedicarse a la repostería.
texts.en:
Silvana  is 31 years old and has 3 school-age children. She earns a living making and selling bread. Her bakery is located in the area of Plan 3000 and she sells her bread as a street vendor around the whole area since she does not have her own stall. 

This is her first loan with the institution. Silvana will use the loan to buy a bigger oven as she is unable to meet the demand for her bread now that she is well-known in the area and has increased her clientele and her sales. 

Silvana wants to get on in life and is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she has received. This is the only means she has of providing for herself and her family. In time she hopes to have a shop where she can sell her bread and also be able to make and sell pastries.

loans.use: to buy a bigger oven.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Augusto con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa de su suegra. Mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura con el cuidado de sus sembríós de maíz y papa, que diariamente cuida en los terrenos agrícolas de su pueblo. Ella acondicionó un espacio en su casa y ahí elaboró jaulas de buena calidad donde cría cuyes, gallinas y conejos los cuales comercializa cuando ya se encuentran maduros. Afirma que gracias a su buena disposición en el cuidado de los animales tiene muchas ganancias, “vivo cerca de la ciudad por lo que los carniceros llegan constantemente a mi casa para comprar los animales”, afirma. Ahora desea aumentar su ganando para poder abastecer la demanda que tiene con sus compradores. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marcelina, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en: Marcelina is 29 years old and is hard-working.  She lives with her husband, Augusto, with whom she has three children.  Marcelina looks after the children in her mother-in-law's house.  Marcelina's husband works in agriculture and every day goes out to his land - in the local town - to look after his corn and potato crops.  Marcelina has created a space in her house where she has good quality cages for raising guinea pigs, hens and rabbits.  Once old enough, she sells these animals.  Marcelina tells us that, thanks to her abilities in raising animals, she has high profits:  "I live close to the city so meat vendors are constantly coming to my house to buy animals".  Marcelina now wants to increase her number of animals in order to satisfy her buyers' demands.  This is her second Kiva loan loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving; it will allow her to increase her income.  Marcelina promises to be punctual with her repayments.  Marcelina will invest the 1500 Nuevo Soles in feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 45 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene una ferretería donde vende diferentes productos como por ejemplo calaminas, clavos, alambres, pinturas y otras cosas más, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pinturas, clavos, tornillos, cerraduras, siliconas y otras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Herminia was born in the city of Puno but now lives in Paucartambo.  She is 45 years old and has a partner, with whom she has three children.  Herminia is a hard-working and enterprising mother and, through her work, she is helping her family get ahead.  Herminia has a hardware store where she sells different products, such as corrugated iron, nails, wires, paints and other items.  Herminia has been a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank for a number of years.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise such as paint, nails, screws, locks, silicone and more.  Herminia is grateful for and values this loan and promises to be responsible and make her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as paint, nails, screws, locks, silicone and more.

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
SUBIRA, who is in her mid 30's, is married and has three children, a boy and two girls, all of whom are in school. For three years now, SUBIRA has been running three activities, selling charcoal, clothes and shoes. She has been selling her clothes and shoe stock door-to-door and mostly on credit. She works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. This is her sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use it to buy more sacks of charcoal from villages and clothes to resell. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she managed to buy more business stock.  With the profit received, she covered school fees and home expenses and bought a bed, a mattress, a fridge and a music player(sabufa). SUBIRA is working hard in her businesses. She dreams that one day she will able to build her own clothes and shoes selling premises. 
She will share this loan with her loan group "Jitahidi Msakuzi" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal from villages and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her direct-selling business. Gilda has been in this business for ten years. Gilda earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is 33 years old.  She is married and has one child. Gelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.  Gelma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Gelma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lory Jane

texts.en:
Lory Jane is 30 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents.

Lory Jane has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Lory Jane has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kitwe United Development Group

texts.en:
Ivan, a widower in his mid-30s, is a member of Kitwe United Development Group, located in rural Ibanda. Its various members are dealing in a variety of businesses, such as petty trade, farming, crafts, and livestock. 

After the demise of his wife, Ivan's life significantly changed, as he narrates. He took over the responsibilities of looking after the four children he had been left with, at the same time working to ensure that they would survive. 

Ivan dropped all the other businesses which required extensive travel, so that he can effectively attend to both family and work. He, thus, concentrated on farming, which he says has enabled him to make several achievements, like paying school fees, catering for medical and feeding expenses, and building another house for the family. 

Ivan has now applied for a loan of only UGX.100,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, through the group, to buy organic fertilizer, in the form of decomposed cow dung, which he will spread on his banana plantation to improve his yields. Ivan is very hard-working. In the photo are the group members and Ivan is the one standing.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy key cutting tools

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29 year-old married man. He is a father with two kids, a son and a daughter. Mahmoud is a worker in a local organization.  He gets a low income that is not enough to cover all the family needs. 
Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some needed furniture, like living room seats and a bedroom. Mahmoud and his wife would like to improve their home mainly because the furniture is old and needs to be changed.

loans.use: to buy some needed furniture, like living room seats and a bedroom

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is 61 years old and is a widow.  She has fourteen children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Hope is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies. Hope has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 35 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for two years, and she earns additional income from direct selling.

Jinky is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional sacks of feed. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her poultry

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 38-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard, so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Eight years ago, her husband started a tailoring business. His customers love his services.

Sumera is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a tailoring machine since his current machine has stopped working. This will help him to continue his work and cater to the customers' needs on-time. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Sumera hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine for her husband to stitch-up dresses.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 45, is a homemaker in Lahore. She and her husband have six children. Her husband owns a clothing shop in the market, which serves as the only source of income for the family. He purchases a variety of clothing items from various areas and sells these in his shop.

Safia's husband is interested in offering a greater variety to his customers, an investment that will help him to increase his net income as well as his savings. At the present time, however, he cannot make this investment due to the lack of available capital. Safia has therefore decided to request a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of clothes and sell them in the market at profitable prices. 

With the expected profit, her husband intends to continue to grow his business. 

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for her husband to sell in his shop

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Muslima, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has two children -- one son and one daughter. One of her children is enrolled in school. For seven years, Muslima has had a cosmetics shop. She opens from 10:00AM to 7:00PM, daily. From working at the business for this time, Muslima is able to receive a better return per month.

This is Muslima's tenth loan request to Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Muslima purchased more cosmetics to sell at her shop. She will use this new loan to buy products that are missing from her cosmetics line. She uses her profits from business to cover school fees, home expenses, and to save in her bank account. Her dreams are to be a big businesswoman, and well-known.
 
Muslima will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which is comprised of seven members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy products that are missing from her cosmetics line

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian es padre soltero, tiene domiclio propio en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como oficial de crédito en un Banco donde percibe un sueldo con el cual se mantiene y cubre sus mas mínimas necesidades. Necesita crédito para la compra de un lavamanos e inodoro para su departamento y poder tener las mínimas comodidades que le permitan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Cristian is a single father, he lives in his own house in the city of La Paz. He is currently working as a loan official at a bank and his salary is just enough for his maintenance and for covering his minimum necessities.

He needs this loan in order to buy a sink and a toilet for his apartment, these minimum conveniences will allow him to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a sink and a toilet for his home

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah, a 42-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from 13 to 21 years. lives in Mombasa, Kenya. Her husband has a job and earns an income that contributes to the support of the family.

Eddah has been in the water-supply business for more than ten years. Her major challenges are water rationing and bad customer debt. She learned of Milango through a group of women and is now requesting a loan to buy a water tank, water pipes and taps to start another water point outlet. In five years time she hopes to own more than five water points supplying water to the whole town.

The extra income that Eddah raises from the business will improve her living standards and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, water pipes and taps

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Doña angelina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada y madre de 7 hijos una familia muy numerosa y unida con un grado de educación primario incompleta el cual no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres.  En compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se trasladan al campo para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café como ser: Fumigación, Limpieza, Abono, Corte de cosecha, entre otros. Ella es una mujer emprendedora por lo cual vio la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo y decidió abrir una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación con la cual puede ayudar a generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. La tierra que ella en compañía de su familia trabaja es propia la cual está ubicada a unos pocos metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie. 

Ella necesita mejorar sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia y protegiéndolos con insumos agrícolas que ayudan a hacer su producto más atractivo y vistoso para sus clientes por lo cual ha solicitado un financiamiento a la Cooperativa COMIXMUL para inyectar capital a sus cultivos.

Ella sueña con tener una tierra productiva, atractiva con un producto como el café con calidad con el cual ella 
pueda generar ingresos para su familia y hogar y pueda extender sus cultivos formando y fortaleciendo un patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Angelina is 46 years old, married and a mother to seven children.  This is a large but united family.  Angelina did not complete primary school because she did not have the necessary financial support from her parents.  Alongside her husband and children, she goes out to the country to look after and maintain her coffee crops, doing work such as fumigation, cleaning, putting down manure, harvesting and more.  Angelina is a enterprising and, so, saw a need to help her husband.  She decided to start a small grocery store in her home.  With it she can help generate an income to cover basic necessities for the family.  The land that Angelina works is her own.  It is located just a few metres from their home and so they arrive there by foot.

Angelina needs to improve her crops, giving them more help and protecting them better, by using farming supplies that will make her product more attractive for her clients.  To give the crops this protection, Angelina is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" to inject some capital into her business.

Angelina's dream is to have productive and attractive land and quality coffee.  With this she can generate an income to support her family and household.  Angelina dreams of extending her land and having something to leave for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea and more for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Regen

texts.en:
Regen, age 42, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this activity for the past eight years. She earns an additional income from running a small general store. She and her husband have three children.

Regen is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol is 60 years old and is a single mother of three children, two of whom are married while her last-born child is studying in a 4-year program at a local university.  He is majoring in medicine and is going to graduate soon. At the same time, he works for a Christian organization using his medical skills to support his living.

Being a helpful mother, Kol is requesting this loan to help her son cover his expenses to write his thesis in order to earn a bachelor degree. Kol hopes that her son will be able to graduate and earn a degree through the loan support. She appreciates to all kind lenders

loans.use: pay university expenses for her son

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y le encanta vivir en esta ciudad pues sus padres también vivieron allí, ella tiene 55 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde expende diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, pan, gaseosas, cigarros, cerveza, chocolates, conservas y   otras cosas más, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz , fideos, conservas y otras, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Estela was born in the city of Paucartambo and she loves living there because this is where her parents used to live. She is 55 years old and is in a civil union, the couple has seven children. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who raises her family with the help of her work. She runs a grocery store where she sells different products such as rice, sugar, noodles, bread, soft drinks, cigars, beer, chocolates, canned food, and more. 

She is a member of the communal bank Virgen del Rosario since several years back. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, noodles, canned food, and more. She is grateful and values this loan, and she pledges to make her monthly repayments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, noodles, canned food, and more

loans.name: Morphy

texts.en:
Morphy is a single man aged 31 years with no dependent.  He owns a boutique in Eldama Ravine and has been in this business for a period of about 2 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Being a member of a self-help group in KADET LTD, Morphy is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 which he intends to purchase more clothing for resale.  The anticipated amounts will be used to start the same business in a different location.

His dream is to see his business grow and also develop his land by building residential houses.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 48, is married and has five children.  She is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. 

To make a living, Concepcion runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. She has been in business for more than ten years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from her store.  In addition to her business, she engages in a charcoal selling to earn additional income.

Concepcion is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more charcoal for retail.

In 2008, Concepcion joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, age 34, runs a small-scale horticultural business as well as a retail shop business in Kapsabet. She has been earning an income through these enterprises for the last 15 years and earns an average monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

Eunice lives with her husband Hosea and their children. Both parents help to support the family.

She plans to use the her KES 50, 000 loan funds to pay her children’s school fees. She intends to use the profits from the retail shop business to repay her loan as well as to pay the remainder of her children’s school fees. 

Eunice's dream is to expand her businesses further.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional products like noodles, rice, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

Vicenta has been in this business for 2 years. She also earns additional income from food vending.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and food vending business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, age 47, runs a retail store business to earn an income. She and her husband have six children and live in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a fisherman. They have been engaged in their respective businesses for 13 years. 

Elma joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008 in order to access micro-credit loans to boost her business. She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase additional goods to offer for sale, such as animal feed. 

She hopes to improve her business in order to offer her family better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to offer for sale in her store, such as animal feed

loans.name: Afsha's Group

texts.en:
Afsha is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has one child. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of vegetables in his shop, which includes carrots, peas, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, lemons, and lady fingers. 

Afsha's husband is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Afsha, as member of a two-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Afsha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. In the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly.  Because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Shahnaz has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business and to generate income to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Shahnaz is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Basanti Devi

texts.en:
Basanti Devi is 31 years old and lives in the Sitalpur village of Dharmnagar VDC in the Bara district of Nepal. She is married with three children. She has a grocery shop that sells goods like rice, pulse, oil and many other things. She has a very good personal reputation within her community, and a good customer base who comes regularly in her grocery shop to buy different types of food items. 

Basnati Devi had requested a loan amount of 45000 Nepalese Rupees to buy different types of food items and other non-food items for her grocery shop to meet the ever increasing demand. She hopes that her business will thrive enough to support the needs of her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 48-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a crockery shop in the market.  This is the only source of income for the family. He sells variety of crockery in his shop. He is famous in his community market. All of his customers love the crockery he sells as he offer new variety to them.

Presently Yasmeen's husband is interested in offering more variety to his customers.  This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well.
