However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Yasmeen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase a variety of crockery with the goal of reselling them at profitable prices. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of crockery to resell.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 34, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband manufactures furniture and sells them in the main market. This is a profitable business and is the only source of income for the family. 

Yasmeen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase wood to manufacture furniture to sell. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy wood to make furniture to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 43 años, está casada con Carlos y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Ana se dedica a la venta de comidas en un espacio que acondicionó en la casa de su padre , además vende bebidas gasificadas y refrescos naturales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares, pues la labor de albañil que realiza su esposo no le alcanza para poder cubrir los gastos. Por ello piensa mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y de esa manera obtener más ganancias para poder cubrir los estudios superiores de su hijo mayor. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ana, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros , para la preparación de sus alimentos y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también bebidas gasificadas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and married to Carlos. She lives with her two children in the house she owns. Ana works selling foods in a part of her father's house reserved for this purpose. She also sells soft drinks and natural fruit juices. What she likes most about her work is that she is able to help with the expenses of the family. Her husband works as a bricklayer and his salary is not enough to cover all the expenses. This is why she wants to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant, thus increasing her profits and being able to pay for her oldest son's higher education. 

This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the support she has received. She promises to make her repayments in time. Ana will use the 2500 PEN to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. for the preparation of her foods. If the money is enough she will also buy soft drinks in bulk.

loans.use: to buy foods and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of new clothes

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina, age 37, lives with her husband and children in Lahore. Her husband is very hard-working and loves his family very much, making every effort to make sure that his family's needs are fully met. 

To earn income to support the family, Rubina's husband is involved in a manufacturing and furniture sales business, where he makes and sells such items as beds and tables. He started this business over 10 years ago. 

Rubina herself stays at home and looks after her children. Because her children are still very young, they need constant care. She also takes care of her elderly parents.

Today, Rubina's husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income, but the family's needs are increasing day by day, and Rubina finds that she needs more money in order to afford household expenses. In order to remedy this problem, she would like to request a loan in order to buy more raw materials for her husband to use for making furniture, allowing him to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan. 

She wishes to obtain a loan of Rs. 45,000 so that her husband will be able to buy additional raw materials for making furniture. She is confident that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for the family.
 
Rubina offers her thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this invaluable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Abdel Hussein

texts.en:
Abdel Hussein is from Iraq. He is a 38-year-old married client. Abdel Hussein owns a small workshop where he specializes in repairing motor generators. He has been practicing this business since 2006 and, thanks to his wide knowledge of electronics and his affordable prices, Abdel Hussein is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation.

Adbel Hussein is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. The aim of this loan is to install some shelves in his shop, install signage and buy some tools. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install some shelves in his shop, install signage and buy some tools

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 42, earns an income by operating a catering business as well as a retail shop business that sells household items. She has been running these enterprises for the past six years. With the help of her husband, she has also been able to buy a coaster, a bus-sized vehicle that allows her to offer transportation services. This has allowed Sarah to increase her income.

Sarah and her husband have seven children. She also supports and cares for two orphans.

Sarah is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for the coaster in order to replace the old ones, which are now worn down. 

Sarah is a hard-working woman and she would like to thank Ugafode for offering affordable rates to people like herself, her husband, and other community members who have gone from having nothing to owning assets like taxis. She also wants to offer her appreciation to Kiva for the good work of empowering communities.

loans.use: to buy tires for her transportation vehicle

loans.name: Juana Marlene

texts.es: Juana Marlene nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 42 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella es profesora y enseña en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la agricultura donde siembra papas, cebada, trigo, maíz y otros cosas más, ella  pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios años entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar por ejemplo semillas y abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juana Marlene was born in the city of Paucartambo, and she lives in the same city.  She is 42 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who gets her family ahead with the effort of her work.

She is a teacher, and she teaches at one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo.  However, in her free time she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, corn, and other things.  She has belonged to the Virgen del Rosario communal bank for several years.  This time she needs a loan to buy things like seeds and fertilizer.  She is grateful for and values the loan.  She pledges to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy things like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother of one child. She is 49 years old and resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Philippines. To earn a living, Elena has been growing rice to sell for more than 11 years. During harvest time, she becomes a dealer in rice also, buying rice from her fellow farmers to resell in town.

Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 40,000. She will use most of this amount to finance her rice purchases from fellow farmers. A portion of this loan will be used for weeding maintenance of her own farm.

In the future, Elena wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance her rice purchases from fellow farmers, and to have her own farm weeded

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, age 51 and widowed, is a rice farmer. She owns and manages her own farmland, and has been engaged in this work for many years in order to earn an income. She has three children and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboang del Sur. 

She would like to expand her farm and increase her rice production. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to finance these improvements to her rice production business. 

Flora is confident that she will have an abundant harvest and thereby gain more income, which will allow her to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance her rice production business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eda Ebelinda

texts.es:
Eda es una joven soltera de 22 años de edad, con un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como maestra de educación primaria y actualmente estudiante universitaria preparándose para enfrentar algunos problemas económicos de manera favorable. En compañía de sus padres ella trabaja la tierra el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol pero su mayor desafío es el de tener sus cultivos sanos y protegidos de plagas y enfermedades como la roya y la broca ya que en el mercado los insumos para atacar esta clase dañina a sus cultivos es cara e inestable en sus precios. La tierra que en compañía de sus padres trabaja es propia la cual está ubicada a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica. 

Por lo tanto ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual pretende dar una mejor asistencia y mayor protección como también el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café comprando abono, urea, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, etc.

Sus metas son graduarse en la universidad apoyar a sus padres como hasta hoy en día lo ha hecho y ver que sus cultivos de café son productivos, generadores de empleo y atractivos para sus clientes y demás compradores de la zona.
texts.en:
Eda, 22, is a single young woman who completed secondary school and graduated as an elementary school teacher.  Currently she's in the university preparing herself to favorably confront some economic problems.

She and her parents are farmers; they grow coffee, corn, and beans.  Her biggest challenge is having a healthy crop that's protected from pests and diseases such as Roya [coffee rust disease] and Broca [coffee berry borer], because in the market the supplies to attack this type of crop danger are expensive and the prices unstable.

The land she and her parents farm is their own.  Located 30 minutes from their home, they go there to maintain it and provide technical help.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy soil amendments, urea, coffee formula, fertilizer, etc.  This way she can provide better help and greater protection as well as maintain her crops.

Her goals are to graduate from college, help her parents as she has done up to the present, and have productive coffee crops that generate jobs and other things that appeal to her customers and other buyers in the area.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: Jose Felix nació en la ciudad del Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, él tiene 42 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él es una padre joven, trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, él es profesor y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo y en sus horas libres enseña de forma particular a jóvenes que necesitan refuerzo en los estudios entonces de esta manera ayuda a casta familiar y por ser una persona responsable le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles de escritorio como papeles y lapiceros, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Jose Felix was born in the city of Cusco, but he currently lives in the city of Paucartambo.  He is 42 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  He is a young, hard-working, and enterprising father who gets his family ahead with the effort of his work.

He is a teacher, and he works at one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo.  In his free time he teaches private students who need their studies reinforced.  This way he helps his family.  He was invited to participate in the Virgen del Rosario communal bank because he is a responsible person.

He now needs a loan to buy desk supplies like paper and pens.  He is grateful for and values the loan.  He pledges to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy desk supplies like paper and pens.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 26 years old. For the past three years, he has earned a living by selling household items in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of 30,000 KES. 

He was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer, and now he is applying for his second loan, in the amount of 60,000 KES. This will help him to purchase additional stock to sell to his customers, such as new basins, lamps, water buckets, and other items of that kind. 

Festus will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his nephew. His goal for the future is to own a well-established general store in the area, which will improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell to his customers, such as new basins, lamps, water buckets, and other items of that kind.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is 22 years old. She is married and lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with her family, comprised of four members. Her husband is in the military. Nawal is currently studying, in her fourth year pursuing a Bachelor of Arabic Literature degree. She is planning to work in her field of study, after graduation. Because she is facing financial problems, she is asking for a loan to enable her to pay her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is now 18 years old. He is a man who has a passion to continue to develop his capabilities. 

He is now is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He chose the Tehnika program. Nour will be a technician and wants to be professional, in a ship. His father works as a day laborer in projects, and his income is very minimal, just enough for the family to live day to day. If one day he does not work, his father does not get the money. 

The expectation of his parents is that he can complete his study and quickly get the job he wants. Nour is anxious for his parents’ happiness, and he wants to help the two younger siblings. 

Nour then applied for a loan from Kiva to help him pay for his learning and cover all the needs of college. Nour is very grateful to the lenders, who will help in his lectures. Hopefully, this loan for him will please his parents.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 60 años es una mujer alegre y muy tímida. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pedro con quien tiene 7 hijos a los que cuidaron y educaron pero ahora solo vive con su hija menor en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, desde pequeña aprendió lo necesario para emprender sus propios sembríos pues proviene de una familia agricultora. Cuando formó su familia comenzó entonces a sembrar alverja, papa, habas y demás productos propios del lugar. Según comenta alquilaban terrenos agrícolas para sembrar pero poco a poco con la ayuda de sus ahorros compraron extensiones de tierra que se sumaban a los heredados por sus padres, es así que ahora cuentan con varios terrenos donde siembran por cantidad. Según comenta en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en una ciudad cercana, en donde reciben un buen precio por el alimento y de esa manera pueden obtener mayores ganancias. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y ahorrar para su vejez, pues también cría vacas ya tiene 7 ejemplares que con la leche que producen recibe un dinero extra todos los días. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, espera con mucha ilusión poder mejorar sus ingresos con el apoyo financiero, además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Manuela invertirá los 4,500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos ya que cuenta con amplios terrenos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 60, is a happy and very shy woman.  She lives with her husband, Pedro, with whom she has seven children.  They took care of and educated them, but now only her youngest daughter lives with them in their own house.

Her main work focuses on agriculture.  She comes from a farming family, so when she was a little girl she learned what was necessary to set up her own fields.  When she started her family she began to grow peas, potatoes, beans, and other food products for her household.  She says they rented farmland but, little by little, with the help of their savings, they bought pieces of land to add to what they had gotten from their parents.  This is how they currently have various plots of land where they grow in quantity.  

She says she sells her harvest in a nearby city where she gets a good price for her food and they're able to earn more profits.  Now she wants to improve the quality of her crops and save for her old age.  She also raises cows; she has seven cows and receives extra money every day from the milk they produce.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's waiting hopefully to be able to improve her income with the financial support.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Manuela will invest the 4,500 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments for her fields, because she has a lot of land.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Razan

texts.en:
Razan was born in 1991. She is married and lives in Amman, Jordan. Her husband has a restaurant. Razan has been working in selling blankets and clothing, including 'abayat,' for two years. She started her project when she sold a golden lamp to one of her neighbors. She sold it for a good price and realised that selling might be profitable work. So, she started selling other products.

One of the obstacles Razan is facing is that she depends on her neighbors to bring her customers. She is facing a problem with marketing her products. Razan is planning to expand her project in the future. Now she is asking for a youth loan, which she will use to buy more items to sell, including blankets, 'abayat,' and other clothes.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including blankets, 'abayat,' and other clothes.

loans.name: Anna Maria

texts.en:
Anna Maria works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Anna Maria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for her foods, like bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, and sugar. In the future, Anna Maria would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her foods, like bananas, sweet potatoes, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Moushtak

texts.en:
Moushtak is a married Iraqi youth client. He is 25 years old and the father of three children. Moushtak works hard to provide his family's income alone, while his wife takes care of their children.

Moushtak owns a grocery store where he sells all the needs of a household like canned food, tissue papers, dairy products, snacks and detergents. He has been practicing this business since 2006, and has gained all the needed experience through practice. Moushtak has gained a good reputation in the neighborhood and is well known by many.

Moushtak is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD in order to install a new display window for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide the needs of his family and enhance their current financial conditions.

loans.use: to install a new display window for his grocery store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 55, is a tailor. She has been in this business for 25 years. This hard-working entrepreneur has four children and lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental.

Arlene has requested a PhP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

In the future, Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years and works hard to support her family. Belinda lives with her husband and family in Cauayan, Negros Occidental.

She is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional boxes of fish to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Belinda would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya was born in 1982. She is married and has six children. 

Alya has been working in selling clothes and housewares for five years. She started her project at a small room in her house. Then she started expanding her project by building a small room near her house because she didn’t find enough space for the products inside her house. 

Now she is asking for a loan to buy more clothes and housewares in order to trade them, as she found this project profitable. It will bring her good income, which will help her cover her children’s needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and housewares.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Celestin est un homme de 37 ans,marié . il fait dans la vente de la restauration ambulente depuis  08 ans dans un marché de la place.compte tenu de la forte demande,il est confronté à un problème constant de orupture de stock. c'est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de denrée alimentaires ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande des clients et et de réaliser les bénéfices.lesquels l'aideront à réaliser ses projets tels:agrandir son activité en mettant sur pied un restaurant digne de ce nom. de même il aimerait satisfaire les besoins de sa famille en envoyant ses enfants à l'école.
texts.en: Celestin is a married man who is 37 years of age. He has worked selling food in a local market for the past eight years but, given the high demand for his products, he constantly has to face up to ongoing stock shortages. It is for this reason that Celestin has requested a loan to increase his stock of food products, which will allow him to meet customer demand and make a profit. This profit will allow him to go ahead with his plans, which include expanding his business and opening a great restaurant he can be proud of. Celestin would also like to provide for his family, as well as to send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy food products in bulk.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankourou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Nabary (troisième femme assise au milieu des assises compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 1 group are all married, and live in traditional families. The have an average age of 47, and on average have four children each. They all live in the village of Banankourou, located in the Ségou region (Mali’s fourth-largest administrative region). The group members know one another through their winter agricultural businesses, and also because they are family members, related through marriage, or neighbors in the village. 

The members of this group work growing peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small pieces of equipment, supplies of seeds and farming inputs, and to pay for the labor involved in hoeing their fields, the members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan cycle. Nabary (the third person seated) plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farming inputs in Ségou, as well as small pieces of equipment from local blacksmiths. She also wants to pay local young people to hoe her fields. Nabary sells her produce for cash at the end of the rainy season. She will use her profit to repay her loan, and also to be able to provide for her children and some of her family members.

loans.use: To buy small pieces of equipment, seeds, and farming inputs, as well as to pay for the labor involved in hoeing her fields.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankourou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Ba Hawa 1ère  femme debout à partir de la gauche  compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 2 group are all married, and live in traditional families. The have an average age of 37, and on average have three children each. They all live in the village of Banankourou, located in the Ségou region (Mali’s fourth-largest administrative region). The group members know one another through their winter agricultural businesses, and also because they are family members, related through marriage, or neighbors in the village.  

The members of this group work growing peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small pieces of equipment, supplies of seeds and farming inputs, and to pay for the labor involved in hoeing their fields, the members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan cycle. Ba Hawa (the first person standing on the left) plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farming inputs in Ségou, as well as small pieces of equipment from local blacksmiths. She also wants to pay local young people to hoe her field. Ba Hawa sells her produce for cash at the end of the rainy season. She will use her profit to repay her loan, and also to be able to provide for her children and some of her family members.

loans.use: To buy small pieces of equipment, seeds, and farming inputs, as well as to pay for the labor involved in hoeing her fields.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 personas  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “trabajando para el futuro” una de ellas es la Sra. mercedes  de 37 años conviviente y con 1  hijo, la Sra. Mercedes  se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de ropa tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de su hijo, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Mercedes  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de su hijo. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que su hijo sea profesional es por eso  que la Sra. Mercedes    trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropas y poder tener mas ingresos económicos. La Sra. Mercedes  está sentada se le observa que tiene un papel sobre la mano, la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Trabajando para el Futuro Group is made up of eight responsible members in various commercial activities.

One of them is Mercedes, 37.  She has a partner and one son.  Mercedes has made a living for three years selling clothing for women and men in a small space every day so she can get ahead and be able to pay for her son's school.

With the fruit of her labor Mercedes has managed to improve her home, help with her child's education, and continue improving her business.  Her biggest desire is for her son to be a professional.  This is why Mercedes works a lot.

With the loan she'll invest in buying more clothing so she can have more income.

Mercedes is seated and has a piece of paper on top of her hand.  At the same time she sends a hug to Kiva and to EDAPROSPO.  She's grateful for the loan granted because it makes it possible for her to move forward.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice sells second-hand clothes in Mombasa, Kenya. She has done the business for six years now, and this is her sole source of income. She is 30 years old, married, and has been blessed with two children, aged 6 and 3 years. She has a vision of one day becoming a supplier in the major markets in Mombasa.

She knew of Milango through a friend, and she decided to join so that she could access funding. She now seeks a loan, which she will use to buy an additional five bales of second-hand clothes, as stock for her business. The challenges in the business include customers who take on credit but fail to pay in time. The extra income that she will get by using this loan, will pay school fees for her children. Her living standard will also improve.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gold rings, bangles and necklaces

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is 43 years old. She is a hardworking and glorious woman. 

During some years, Shoira had worked in Russia. She had problems with her health, and that’s why she has returned home. In Tajikistan, she does not have a job, as she has no higher education or any profession. She appealed to IMON for support. She studied at the course, “To Get Ahead”, with a women’s organization and got a certificate. 

She wants to organize her own business with animal husbandry. Her husband will help her with managing the business. Her husband is a welder. She has a son whose name is Giyas. Giyas is 21 years old. 

Shoira learnt more information about business from the course “To Get Ahead”, and she thanks the women’s organization and IMON. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni from Kiva and its field partner, IMON, to buy cattle and feed. 

She awaits your support, and in advance thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi is a widowed woman with three children. One of her children still attends school and the rest have left school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Nzalambi has operated a poultry business for the past three years. She sells her poultry at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenges to be sickness and disease of her poultry. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more chickens and buy medicine for her poultry. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and medicine for her poultry

loans.name: Juana De Arco Group

texts.es: La sra. Ana de 47 años de edad casada y con 2 hijos, es una mujer audaz es por eso que decidió emprender un pequeño negocio de productos de belleza,actualmente le va muy bien y tiene el apoyo de su familia y de sus hijos. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra productos de belleza ya que la sra. Ana le va muy bien el en negocio y asi seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades del cliente . La Sra. Ana  junto a las demás integrantes del grupo "JUANA DE ARCO" agradecen a KIVA, y los diferentes inversionistas por la confianza depositada en ellos. La Sra. Ana  es la mujer que viste un chaleco plomo se encuentra en el medio  y se le observa cogiendo un lapicero y el cuaderno que esta sobre la mesa. Se despide Dejando la promesa que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Ms Ana is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She is an innovative woman.  For this reason she decided to launch a small beauty product business.  Currently, it is going very well and she has the support of her family and her two children.  The loan that she is asking for is to purchase beauty products. Her business is doing very well, and she wants to continue satisfying the needs of her customers. 

Ms Ana, along side other members of the "JUANA DE ARCO" group, is grateful for KIVA, EDAPROSPO and other investors for the trust placed in them.  Ana is the woman in the middle wearing the heavy vest holding the pen and notebook on the table. She leaves promising that she will fulfill all her proposed goals.

loans.use: beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Celestrina

texts.es: Celestrina, de 57 años es una mujer trabajadora. Enviudó hace 15 años, tuvo 6 hijos, pero ahora solo cuida de 3 de ellos en una casa alquilada hace 2 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos ánimos por progresar en la vida. Desde el amanecer, se dedica al trabajo de limpieza en la gobernación de su localidad. Mientras que por las tardes y después de unas horas de descanso ella continúa su labor vendiendo comida y  bebidas típicas a base de raíces que crecen en la zona. “Busco las diversas fiestas que se desarrollan para vender comida y bebidas dependiendo el caso, me ayuda mi hija”, comenta. Ahora se encuentra aprovechando la temporada de fiesta en su localidad, en donde espera vender y obtener muchas ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Celestrina, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los platos de comida tales como arroz, verduras, carnes, entre otros.
texts.en: Celestrina, 57, is a hardworking woman,. She was widowed 15 years ago. She has six children, though now only three of them live with her in the house that she has rented for two years. She is very dedicated and is highly motivated to build a better life. From the early morning, she works cleaning a local government building. In the afternoons, after a few hours of rest, she continues to work - selling food and beverages typical of her region that are based on root crops that grow in her area. "I seek out different festivals that are going on where I can sell food and beverages. In some cases, my daughter helps me", she reports. At the moment she is taking advantage of the festival season where she lives. She hopes to be able to make a good deal of profit. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the support. She promises to be punctual with her loan repayments. She will invest the 500 nuevos soles in ingredients that she needs in order to make her dishes, such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah was born in 1984. She is married and has three children. Kefah opened her beauty salon at her house eight years ago along with selling house wares. She took courses in cosmetics and computers. She is planning to expand her project in the future by opening her own beauty salon outdoors so that she will earn a better income, which will help her cover her children's needs. One of the obstacles she faced during her work was launching her project in the beginning. Kefah is now asking for a loan to buy cosmetic products for her beauty salon and house wares to sell.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and housewares to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, who is a Kenyan man, is very hard-working and appreciative. He is a hard-working carpenter. He appreciates Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for their loan services that help rural communities to grow. His vision is to expand his business and improve his standard of living.

Joel is requesting for a loan of KES 25,0000 to purchase wood, nails, sandpaper, and wood glue for his business. He joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access the services.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, sandpaper, and wood glue for his business.

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung is a resident from Baray district. She owns and manages a few pieces of farmland, where she grows rice to generate her livelihood and she also raises hogs and poultry to make additional income. Having been in agriculture for more than three years, she has enough good experience to go far in her business.

This time she is taking out a loan of KHR 500,000 from HKL to buy concrete stairs to replace her wooden ladder, which is not safe enough to use. It sounds strange but people living in these areas buy concrete ladders from local markets to use with their wooden house rather than have one built at home because it costs less. In the future, Doung intends to buy extra plots of farm to increase her output.

loans.use: to buy a concrete ladder to replace her wooden ladder, which is not safe enough to use.

loans.name: Marta Margarita

texts.es:
Marta tiene 50 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo, tiene una hija. Ella es comerciante informal desde hace 30 años, su madre fue quien le enseño desde que ella se separo de su esposo y se vio obligada a dedicarse al comercio de frutas y verduras a tiempo completo para llevar el alimento a su hija. 

Las compras las realiza dos veces a la semana en una ciudad que esta a 20 kilómetros de su lugar de origen, debe abordar dos autobuses. Realiza las compras en ese lugar porque las adquiere a mejor precio y con mayor variedad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fruta, verduras, 2 mesas de 3 metros de largo y uno de ancho y carretilla para trasladar la mercadería de su casa al puesto de venta. Con la inversión, dispondrá de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y podrá establecerse en un lugar fijo y no hacerlo de manera ambulante que tanto cansa a la señora caminar todo el día.  También, obtendrá ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus necesidades básicas.  Su sueño, es que su hija se gradúe de la universidad, poseer su propia casa e instalar una tienda en ella.
texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old and is separated from her husband. She has a daughter. She has been an informal merchant for 30 years. Her mother was the one who taught her when she separated from her husband and was obligated to sell fruit and vegetables full time in order to feed her daughter.

She makes purchases twice a week in a city that is 20 kilometers from where she lives. She has to take two buses. She makes the purchases in that place because she gets more variety at a better price.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy fruit, vegetables, two tables 3 meters long and 1 meter wide, and a wheelbarrow to move the merchandise from her house to the stall. With the investment, she will have a greater quantity of merchandise available to offer her customers, and she will be able to establish a fixed location and not be a street vendor, since she gets so tired walking all day long. She will also obtain income that will let her cover her basic needs. Her dreams are for her daughter to graduate from college and to have her own house and put a store in it.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, two tables 3 meters long and 1 meter wide, and a wheelbarrow to move the merchandise from her house to the stall

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten, born in 1969, sells clothes and blankets to earn a living. She has been engaged in this work for the past six years. She started her project in her home with a small quantity of blankets and clothing items and slowly expanded her offerings over time. She would like to continue to expand her inventory by bringing in new products. She carries items for men, women, and children.

Faten is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes and blankets, which she will offer for sale during the upcoming Eid period, a time likely to be profitable for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing items and blankets to offer for sale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar was born in 1976. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. She lives in a rented house in Amman, Jordan and her husband works at selling vegetables and fruit. 

Sahar has been working at selling legumes for five years. She started her project with buying small amounts of seeds and legumes and selling them to her neighbors and relatives. She is planning to open her own store in the future which will bring her good profit that will let her help her husband in covering their children's needs. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to buy legumes in order to sell them as the rise in their price at the market is not letting her buy them easily.

loans.use: To buy legumes in order to resell them

loans.name: Luzmida Lizbeth

texts.es:
Luzmida es una joven de 19 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 3 años es comerciante de artesanias. Actualmente, vende en la casa de su mamá porque tiene en malas condiciones el local donde vendía antes pero pretende mejorarlo y continuar su venta. Antes de ser comerciante se dedicaba a estudiar nada más y ayudaba en los oficios de su casa. Cuando decidió acompañarse no le quedó otra opción que dedicarse a comerciar para obtener ingresos y cubrir sus necesidades familiares pues ya no se sentía bien estar con su madre y estar dependiendo  de sus ingresos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 pliegos de lámina lisa que utilizará para las puertas y ventanas, comprara además 2 pliegos de lámina para una parte del techo, 7 pares de bisagras y el resto del financiamiento lo invertirá en pago de mano de obra calificada y no calificada. Y con el resto del financiamiento surtirá más su negocio de venta de artesanias.
Es de esta forma, como ella pretende mejorar su local para continuar con su negocio. 
Con la construcción de su local mantendrá la mercadería más en orden así tendrá más espacio en su casa, como para reunirse en familia y para que los niños tengan más espacio para recrearse, además mejorara sus ingresos y tener una vida mejor en cuanto a las necesidades del hogar, salud, vivienda, educación, vestuario.
En el futuro comento que quiere comprar mercadería que actualmente no tiene en el negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos, además desde hace meses a planeado junto a su compañero de vida, vender el automóvil que tienen y comprar uno mejor para transportarse pues su compañero de vida  es vendedor de frutas.
texts.en:
Luzmida, 39, is married and has two children.  She has sold handicrafts for three years.

Currently she sells in her mother's house because the space where she used to sell is in bad shape.  She plans to improve it and continue selling, though.  Before she became a merchant she only studied and helped with the housework.  When she decided to get together with her partner, she had no other option than to make a living in sales to earn an income and cover her family necessities, because she didn't feel good about being with her mother and depending on her income.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four metal panels for the doors and windows, two sheets of corrugated metal for part of the roof, and seven pairs of hinges.  She'll invest the rest of the loan in paying for skilled and unskilled labor.

This is how she plans to improve her space to continue with her business.

With the construction of her space she'll keep her merchandise organized and also have more space in her house to get together with her family and for the children to play.  She'll also improve her income and have a better life with regard to household necessities, health, housing, education, and clothing.

She said that in the future, to improve her income, she wants to buy merchandise that she doesn't have right now in her business.  Also, she and her life partner have been planning for several months to sell their automobile and buy a better one for transportation, because he's a fruit vendor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
San Juan de Limay un municipio que pertenece al departamento de Estelí conocido en gran parte por su artesanía y gente trabajadora en la ganadería fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua. Vive  el señor Edwin de 35 años de edad, casado y asesor legal de la alcaldía de su municipio. Su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposa y su hijo.

Actualmente está aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de un financiamiento para el mejoramiento de su unidad sanitaria de su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias y necesita comprar su inodoro económico ,lavamanos, tuberías para conexiones de agua potable, tanque econosan de 1300 litros más gastos de mano de obra  
Porque conocen la importancia de utilizar un saneamiento mejorado 

Por medio  de esta  alianza, su familia tiene acceso a este proyecto que está beneficiando a varios municipios del país, lo que le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida y contribuir al deterioro del medio ambiente, estos programas vienen ayudar a familias con condiciones económicas más pobre que hacen el uso de letrinas,  el cual causan más enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es `por ello la necesidad de hacer estos proyectos dirigidos al sector más vulnerable del país.
texts.en:
San Juan de Limay is a municipality belonging to Estelí Department; it’s widely known for its crafts and hardworking people in animal husbandry.  It was chosen for a program of creating alliances to strengthen local skills for Nicaragua’s recovery.  Edwin, 35, lives here.  He’s married and is a legal assessor for the municipal government.  His nuclear family consists of his wife and son.

He’s currently applying for the water and sewage project by means of financing to improve the bathroom in his house because it does not have the necessary conditions; he needs to buy an economic toilet, wash basin, pipes with potable water connections and Econosan 1,300-liter tank plus to pay labor costs because they know how important it is to use an improved sewage system.

By means of this alliance, his family can access this project that’s benefiting several municipalities in the country which will lead to improved standard of living and help to lessen environmental deterioration.  These programs help the poorest families and this is why these projects need to be aimed at the most vulnerable sectors of the country.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Gracias al crédito otorgado por kiva la temporada pasada Rosario pudo realizar su cambio de café orgánico a café convencional, para esta nueva etapa Rosario solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes que le ayudaran aumentar en crecimiento de sus plantas así como también necesita para el pago de los jornaleros que le ayudaran en las labores de poda y limpia de su finca para que en la próxima cosecha se encuentre en optimas condiciones y recoja una buena cosecha que le ayudara aumentar   sus ganancias económicas y con ello mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thanks to her last loan through Kiva, Rosario was able to switch from growing conventional coffee to organic coffee.  For this next chapter, she is seeking a loan in order to buy fertilizer which will help her to increase production, and also to pay laborers to help in the pruning and weeding of her fields.  This will lead to optimal conditions for her next harvest, and getting a good harvest will help her to increase her earnings and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and also to pay laborers to help in the pruning and weeding of her fields.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buena Esperanza está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres  madres solteras y un hombre  con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios  del  Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gustas cocinar para su familia platos típicos de la región como “indio viejo”. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

La coordinadora del banco comunal Buena Esperanza es Lorenza y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, cuajadas, jugos, gaseosas, galletas, tortillas, tiste, pozol. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo de crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en a compra  y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Buena Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua  para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) consists of nine single mothers and one man who are responsible for 15 children among them.  The members are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. These individuals are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level.  In their free time, they enjoy preparing traditional regional dishes, such as “indio viejo” (a Nicaraguan corn stew), for their families.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to attend school and were obligated to work at a young age.  For this reason, they strive day after day to provide a better future for their children.  

The coordinator for the “Buena Esperanza” Communal Bank is Lorenza.  She has a small general store in her home where she sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, curds, juices, sodas, cookies, tortillas, “tiste” (a traditional beverage made of corn and cacao), and “pozol” (a beverage made from fermented corn dough).  Lorenza works approximately 12 hours a day at her business by offering her products.  She greatly enjoys her job.  The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital to restock her business of buying and selling food products.  In the not-so-distant future, she hopes to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “Buena Esperanza” is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders have provided to low-income people from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent form of work.

loans.use: to restock her store with various food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, assorted biscuits and also gasoline to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is married with six children. She is 51 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for twelve years. She wants to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Lizasol

texts.en:
Lizasol has been engaged in a retail store business for six years. She is married with four children. She utilizes her earned income for their daily necessities and other household expenses. She aims for the continuous growth of her retail store so she could make her business a stable source of income.

With her determination to improve her retail business and get ahead in life, she is requesting financial support from lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 which will be used in buying cases of soft drinks, one can of cooking oil, soy sauce, and snack foods for her retail store. Lizasol believes that through this additional capital and her hard work she could someday achieve her business endeavor.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, one can of cooking oil, soy sauce, and snack foods for her retail store

loans.name: Lidivine

texts.en:
Lidivine, age 31, runs a butcher business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this activity for the past 10 years. She and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school.

With her loan funds, Lidivine intends to purchase more meats to offer for sale in her butcher shop. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy a milling machine for cereal crops.

loans.use: to buy more meats to offer for sale in her butcher shop

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta lives in Mombasa Kenya. She sells water to the residents. This has been her business for the last three years. She has employed two people who help her run the business. She also owns a boutique which earns her extra income. 

In five years time, Jacinta wants to own more branches of her business in the larger town of Mombasa. She is 25 years of age. She is a wife and a mother of one school-going child. She knew Milango Financial Services through a friend. 

Jacinta now seeks a loan to buy ten 20-litre water jerricans for storage purposes. The income raised from the business will improve her living standards and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy ten 20-litre water jerricans.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six months, Betty has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000, Betty wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.
